name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.dynamo-db.profile-name
description: Profile name to use.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.pool.maximum-lifetime
description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool. When a connection reaches this timeout, even if recently used, it will be retired from the pool. An in-use connection will never be retired, only when it is idle will it be removed.

name: cas.ticket.registry.dynamo-db.prevent-table-creation-on-startup
description: Flag that indicates whether to prevent CAS from creating tables.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.trust-store
description: Path to the keystore used to determine which certificates or certificate authorities should be trusted. Used when connecting to an LDAP server via LDAPS or startTLS connection. If left blank, the default truststore for the Java runtime is used.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.keystore-password
description: Keystore password.

name: cas.warning-cookie.path
description: Cookie path. Specifies a path for the cookie to which the client should return the cookie. The cookie is visible to all the pages in the directory you specify, and all the pages in that directory's subdirectories. A cookie's path must include the servlet that set the cookie, for example, /catalog, which makes the cookie visible to all directories on the server under /catalog. Consult RFC 2965 (available on the Internet) for more information on setting path names for cookies.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.sasl-realm
description: The SASL realm.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.mongo.password
description: MongoDb database password for authentication.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.expiration
description: How long in minutes should the password expiration link remain valid.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.bind[].pool.name
description:
Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for
the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.password
description: Login password of the redis server.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.validator.type
description:
Determine the LDAP validator type.

The following LDAP validators can be used to test connection health status:

  • {@code search}: Validates a connection is healthy by performing a search operation. Validation is considered successful if the search result size is greater than zero.
  • {@code none}: No validation takes place.
  • {@code compare}: Validates a connection is healthy by performing a compare operation.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.rest.basic-auth-username
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the username for authentication.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].query-attributes
description:
Define a {@code Map} of query attribute names to data-layer attribute names to use when building the query.
The key is always the name of the query attribute that is defined by CAS and passed internally,
and the value is the database column that should map.

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.crypto.encryption.key-size
description: Encryption key size.

name: cas.authn.mfa.inwebo.bypass.authentication-attribute-value
description: Optionally, skip multifactor authentication based on designated authentication attribute values.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.url
description: The database connection URL.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.name
description: Name of the LDAP handler.

name: cas.ticket.registry.redis.sentinel.node
description: list of host:port pairs.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].sasl-mechanism
description: The SASL mechanism.

name: cas.service-registry.mail.priority
description: Set the priority ({@code X-Priority} header) of the message. Values: {@code 1 (Highest)}, {@code 2 (High)}, {@code 3 (Normal)}, {@code 4 (Low)}, {@code 5 (Lowest)}.

name: cas.authn.cognito.profile-name
description: Profile name to use.

name: cas.saml-sp.give-campus.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.http-web-request.cors.allow-origin-patterns
description: Comma-separated list of origin patterns to allow. Unlike allowed origins which only supports {@code *}, origin patterns are more flexible (for example {@code https://*.example.com}) and can be used when credentials are allowed. When no allowed origin patterns or allowed origins are set, CORS support is disabled.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].azure.id
description: The client id.

name: cas.authn.rest[].order
description: Order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.service-registry.dynamo-db.profile-name
description: Profile name to use.

name: cas.authn.mongo.pool.life-time
description: The maximum time a pooled connection can live for.  A zero value indicates no limit to the life time.  A pooled connection that has exceeded its life time will be closed and replaced when necessary by a new connection.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.pool.suspension
description:
Whether or not pool suspension is allowed.

There is a performance impact when pool suspension is enabled. Unless you need it (for a redundancy system for example) do not enable it.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].idle-time
description:
Removes connections from the pool based on how long they have been idle in the available queue.
Prunes connections that have been idle for more than the indicated amount.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.pool.test-on-return
description: Returns whether objects borrowed from the pool will be validated when they are returned to the pool via the returnObject() method. Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. Returning objects that fail validation are destroyed rather then being returned the pool.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.mongo.database-name
description: MongoDb database instance name.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.core.session-replication.cookie.crypto.signing.key-size
description: The signing key size.

name: cas.authn.x509.require-key-usage
description: Deployer supplied setting to force require the correct KeyUsage extension.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.dropbox.auto-redirect-type
description:
Auto-redirect to this client. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code SERVER}: Redirect on the server side, typically making CAS invisible.
  • {@code CLIENT}: Redirect on the client side using browser redirects, etc.
  • {@code NONE}: Do nothing and let the selection take place manually.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.subtree-search
description: Whether subtree searching is allowed.

name: cas.saml-sp.app-dynamics.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.dynamo-db.billing-mode
description:
Billing mode specifies how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PROVISIONED}: Provisioned mode means that you specify the number of reads and writes per second that you expect your application to use. Provisioned mode is a good option if any of the following are true:
    • You have predictable application traffic.
    • You run applications whose traffic is consistent or ramps gradually.
    • You can forecast capacity requirements to control costs.
    You can use auto scaling to automatically adjust capacity based on the specified utilization rate to ensure application performance while reducing costs.
  • {@code PAY_PER_REQUEST}: Pay-per-request or on-demand billing means that you're charged for only the read/write requests that you use. On-demand mode is a good option if any of the following are true:
    • You create new tables with unknown workloads.
    • You have unpredictable application traffic.
    • You prefer the ease of paying for only what you use.
    Tables using on-demand mode support all DynamoDB features (such as encryption at rest, point-in-time recovery, global tables, and so on) with the exception of auto scaling, which is not applicable with this mode.

name: cas.authn.pm.forgot-username.mail.attribute-name
description: Principal attribute names that indicates the destination email address for this message. The attributes must already be resolved and available to the CAS principal. When multiple attributes are specified, each attribute is then examined against the available CAS principal to locate the email address value, which may result in multiple emails being sent.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.principal.use-existing-principal-id
description: Uses an existing principal id that may have already been established in order to run person directory queries. This is generally useful in situations where authentication is delegated to an external identity provider and a principal is first established to then query an attribute source.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.git.crypto.enabled
description: Whether crypto operations are enabled.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.device-fingerprint.cookie.name
description: Cookie name. Constructs a cookie with a specified name and value. The name must conform to RFC 2965. That means it can contain only ASCII alphanumeric characters and cannot contain commas, semicolons, or white space or begin with a {@code $} character. The cookie's name cannot be changed after creation. By default, cookies are created according to the RFC 2965 cookie specification. Cookie names are automatically calculated assigned by CAS at runtime, and there is usually no need to customize the name or assign it a different value unless a special use case warrants the change.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.dynamo-db.credential-secret-key
description: Use secret key provided by AWS to authenticate.

name: cas.consent.ldap.sasl-security-strength
description: SASL security strength.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].single-logout-service-url
description: When generating SAML2 metadata, configure and set the single logout service URL attribute.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.paypal.display-name
description: Indicate the title or display name of the client for decoration and client presentation purposes. If left blank, the client original name would be used by default.

name: cas.service-registry.amazon-s3.local-address
description: Local address.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.azure.client-id
description: The Azure Active Directory Service Principal client ID.

name: cas.events.dynamo-db.drop-tables-on-startup
description: Flag that indicates whether to drop tables on start up.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.preferred-jws-algorithm
description:
The JWS algorithm to use forcefully when validating ID tokens.
If none is defined, the first algorithm from metadata will be used.

name: cas.server.tomcat.http[].port
description: The HTTP port to use.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].autocommit
description:
The default auto-commit behavior of connections in the pool.
Determined whether queries such as update/insert should be immediately executed
without waiting for an underlying transaction.

name: cas.audit.engine.enabled
description: Whether auditing functionality should be enabled.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.mongo.ssl-enabled
description: Whether connections require SSL.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.case-change.attribute-value-case-change
description: The Attribute value case change.

name: cas.service-registry.schedule.enabled
description: Whether scheduler should be enabled to schedule the job to run.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].order
description: Order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.allow-multiple-dns
description: Whether search/query results are allowed to match on multiple DNs, or whether a single unique DN is expected for the result.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.case-change.attribute-names
description: The Attribute names.

name: cas.saml-sp.zimbra.entity-ids
description: List of entityIds allowed for this service provider. Multiple ids can be specified in the event that the metadata is an aggregate.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].apple.response-mode
description:
The response mode specifies how the result of the authorization request is formatted.
For backward compatibility the default value is empty, which means the default pac4j (empty) response mode is used.
Possible values includes "query", "fragment", "form_post", or "web_message"

name: cas.saml-sp.sserca.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.events.dynamo-db.max-connections
description: Maximum connections setting.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].keystore
description:
Path to the keystore used for SSL connections.
Typically contains SSL certificates for the LDAP server.

name: cas.consent.dynamo-db.proxy-username
description: Optionally specifies the proxy username to connect through.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.crypto.encryption.key-size
description: The encryption key size.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.aws.security-group-name
description: If a security group is configured, only instances within that security group are selected.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.name
description: Name of the LDAP handler.

name: cas.saml-sp.crash-plan.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.rest.basic-auth-password
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the password for authentication.

name: cas.authn.jaas[].password-policy.strategy
description:
Decide how authentication should handle password policy changes. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Default option to handle policy changes.
  • {@code GROOVY}: Handle account password policies via Groovy.
  • {@code REJECT_RESULT_CODE}: Strategy to only activate password policy if the authentication response code is not blocked.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.propagation-behavior-name
description: Defines the propagation behavior for transactions. @see org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].password-encoder.encoding-algorithm
description:
The encoding algorithm to use such as {@code MD5}.
Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT} or {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}.
When used with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it should be one of {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1},
{@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256} or {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA512}.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.aws.secret-key
description: AWS secret key.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.pool.soft-min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)), with the extra condition that at least minIdle object instances remain in the pool. This setting is overridden by getMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis() (that is, if getMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis() is positive, then getSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis() is ignored).

name: cas.sms-provider.sns.proxy-host
description: Optionally specifies the proxy host to connect through.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.sql-delete-security-questions
description: SQL query to delete security questions for the account, if any.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].generate-statistics
description: Allow hibernate to generate query statistics.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.endpoint
description: AWS custom endpoint.

name: cas.events.redis.username
description: Login username of the redis server.

name: cas.authn.jaas[].principal.principal-transformation.blocking-pattern
description:
A regular expression that will be used against the username
to match for blocking/forbidden values.
If a match is found, an exception will be thrown
and principal transformation will fail.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].dn-attribute.add-if-exists
description: The Add if exists.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].validate-timeout
description: Period at which validation operations may time out.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.core.session-replication.cookie.crypto.encryption.key
description: The encryption key is a JWT whose length is defined by the encryption key size setting.

name: cas.events.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.jpa.fetch-size
description: Used to specify number of rows to be fetched in a select query.

name: cas.consent.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.allow-multiple-dns
description: Whether search/query results are allowed to match on multiple DNs, or whether a single unique DN is expected for the result.

name: cas.saml-sp.symplicity.name-id-attribute
description: Attribute to use when generating nameids for this SP.

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.crypto.encryption.key
description: The encryption key. The encryption key by default and unless specified otherwise must be randomly-generated string whose length is defined by the encryption key size setting.

name: cas.consent.jpa.pool.min-size
description: Controls the minimum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.aws.iam-role
description: If you do not want to use access key and secret key, you can specify iam-role. Hazelcast fetches your credentials by using your IAM role. This setting only affects deployments on Amazon EC2. If you are deploying CAS in an Amazon ECS environment, the role should not be specified. The role is fetched from the task definition that is assigned to run CAS.

name: cas.authn.mfa.triggers.http.request-header
description: MFA can be triggered for a specific authentication request, provided the initial request to the CAS /login endpoint contains a request header that indicates the required MFA authentication flow. The header name is configurable, but its value must match the authentication provider id of an available MFA provider.

name: cas.ticket.registry.google-cloud-firestore.crypto.encryption.key
description: The encryption key. The encryption key by default and unless specified otherwise must be randomly-generated string whose length is defined by the encryption key size setting.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.amazon-s3.credential-secret-key
description: Use secret key provided by AWS to authenticate.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].azure.allow-unsigned-id-tokens
description: Whether unsigned id tokens issued as plain JWTs are accepted.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.name
description: Name of the LDAP handler.

name: cas.authn.adaptive.policy.require-timed-multifactor
description: This property binds a valid mfa provider to a collection of rules that deal with triggering mfa based on that provider based on properties of date/time. One may want to force mfa during weekends, after hours, etc and the ruleset provides a modest configuration set where time can also be treated as trigger.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.core.session-replication.cookie.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.audit.redis.cluster.nodes[].id
description: Identifier of this node.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].case-change.attribute-name-case-change
description: The Attribute name case change.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.kafka.topic.name
description: Set the name of the topic.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.bypass.credential-class-type
description: Skip multifactor authentication depending on form of primary credentials. Value must equal the fully qualified class name of the credential type.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].google.response-type
description:
The response type tells the authorization server which grant to execute.
For backward compatibility the default value is empty, which means the default pac4j ("code") response type is used.
Possibles values includes "code", "token" or "id_token".

name: cas.ticket.registry.dynamo-db.use-reaper
description: Flag that indicates whether to use reaper.

name: cas.authn.soap.password-encoder.strength
description: Strength or number of iterations to use for password hashing. Usually relevant when dealing with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT}. When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the salt strength.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.mongo.port
description: MongoDb database port.

name: cas.saml-sp.neo-gov.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.search-entry-handlers[].search-result.limit
description: The default referral limit.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.jpa.read-only
description: Configures the Connections to be added to the pool as read-only Connections.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.trust-manager
description:
Trust Manager options. Trust managers are responsible for managing the trust material that is used when making LDAP trust decisions, and for deciding whether credentials presented by a peer should be accepted. Accepted values are: *
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Enable and force the default JVM trust managers.
  • {@code ANY}: Trust any client or server.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.validate-period
description: Period at which pool should be validated.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].apple.max-clock-skew
description: Clock skew in order to account for drift, when validating id tokens.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.facebook.callback-url
description: Callback URL to use to return the flow back to the CAS server one the identity provider is successfully done. This may be used at the discretion of the client and its type to build service parameters, redirect URIs, etc. If none is specified, the CAS server's login endpoint will be used as the basis of the final callback url.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].principal-transformation.pattern
description:
A regular expression that will be used against the provided username
for username extractions. On a successful match, the first matched group
in the pattern will be used as the extracted username.

name: cas.audit.dynamo-db.connection-timeout
description: Connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.bypass.rest.method
description: HTTP method to use when contacting the rest endpoint. Examples include {@code GET, POST}, etc.

name: cas.authn.jaas[].principal.principal-attribute
description:
Attribute name to use to indicate the identifier of the principal constructed.
If the attribute is blank or has no values, the default principal id will be used
determined by the underlying authentication engine. The principal id attribute
usually is removed from the collection of attributes collected, though this behavior
depends on the schematics of the underlying authentication strategy.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.keystore
description: Path to the keystore used for SSL connections. Typically contains SSL certificates for the LDAP server.

name: cas.monitor.mongo[].database-name
description: MongoDb database instance name.

name: cas.audit.mongo.password
description: MongoDb database password for authentication.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.mail.cc
description: Email CC address, if any.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.idp-metadata-enabled
description: Whether identity provider metadata artifacts are expected to be found in the database.

name: cas.saml-sp.open-athens.entity-ids
description: List of entityIds allowed for this service provider. Multiple ids can be specified in the event that the metadata is an aggregate.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.mail.html
description: Indicate whether the message body should be evaluated as HTML text.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.jpa.leak-threshold
description: Controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.trust-manager
description:
Trust Manager options. Trust managers are responsible for managing the trust material that is used when making LDAP trust decisions, and for deciding whether credentials presented by a peer should be accepted. Accepted values are: *
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Enable and force the default JVM trust managers.
  • {@code ANY}: Trust any client or server.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.sasl-realm
description: The SASL realm.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.jpa.fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.search-referral.limit
description: The default referral limit.

name: cas.service-registry.jpa.ddl-auto
description:
Hibernate feature to automatically validate and exports DDL to the schema. By default, creates and drops the schema automatically when a session is starts and ends. Setting the value to {@code validate} or {@code none} may be more desirable for production, but any of the following options can be used:
  • {@code validate}: Validate the schema, but make no changes to the database.
  • {@code update}: Update the schema.
  • {@code create}: Create the schema, destroying previous data.
  • {@code create-drop}: Drop the schema at the end of the session.
  • {@code none}: Do nothing.

Note that during a version migration where any schema has changed {@code create-drop} will result in the loss of all data as soon as CAS is started. For transient data like tickets this is probably not an issue, but in cases like the audit table important data could be lost. Using `update`, while safe for data, is confirmed to result in invalid database state. {@code validate} or {@code none} settings are likely the only safe options for production use.

For more info, see this.

name: cas.authn.okta.state
description:
Define the scope and state of this authentication handler and the lifecycle in which it can be invoked or activated. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code ACTIVE}: Active authentication handler, and is invoked by default automatically to verify credentials globally.
  • {@code STANDBY}: Authentication handler is in a semi-enabled state, waiting to be called only on-demand when explicitly asked for.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.pool.timeout-millis
description: The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will wait for a connection to be validated as alive.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.core.map-merge-policy
description:
Define how data items in Hazelcast maps are merged together from source to destination. By default, merges map entries from source to destination if they don't exist in the destination map. Accepted values are:
  • {@code PUT_IF_ABSENT}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination if they don't exist in the destination data structure.
  • {@code HIGHER_HITS}: * Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry has more hits than the destination one.
  • {@code DISCARD}: Merges only entries from the destination data structure and discards all entries from the source data structure.
  • {@code PASS_THROUGH}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination directly unless the merging entry is null
  • {@code EXPIRATION_TIME}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry will expire later than the destination entry. This policy can only be used if the clocks of the nodes are in sync.
  • {@code LATEST_UPDATE}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry was updated more frequently than the destination entry. This policy can only be used if the clocks of the nodes are in sync.
  • {@code LATEST_ACCESS}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry has been accessed more recently than the destination entry. This policy can only be used if the clocks of the nodes are in sync.

You can adjust this behavior by modifying this setting. The unit of time here is seconds.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].ddl-auto
description:
Hibernate feature to automatically validate and exports DDL to the schema. By default, creates and drops the schema automatically when a session is starts and ends. Setting the value to {@code validate} or {@code none} may be more desirable for production, but any of the following options can be used:
  • {@code validate}: Validate the schema, but make no changes to the database.
  • {@code update}: Update the schema.
  • {@code create}: Create the schema, destroying previous data.
  • {@code create-drop}: Drop the schema at the end of the session.
  • {@code none}: Do nothing.

Note that during a version migration where any schema has changed {@code create-drop} will result in the loss of all data as soon as CAS is started. For transient data like tickets this is probably not an issue, but in cases like the audit table important data could be lost. Using `update`, while safe for data, is confirmed to result in invalid database state. {@code validate} or {@code none} settings are likely the only safe options for production use.

For more info, see this.

When positive, the number of tests performed for a run will be the minimum of the configured value and the number of idle instances in the pool. When negative, the number of tests performed will be ceil(getNumIdle()/ abs(getNumTestsPerEvictionRun())) which means that when the value is -n roughly one nth of the idle objects will be tested per run.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.cloud-membership-provider
description:
Cloud membership provider, values are case sensitive and only used with clusteringType {@code CLOUD}. The different providers rely on environment variables to discover other members of cluster via DNS lookups of the service name or querying kubernetes API. See code or Tomcat documentation for the environment variables that are used.
  • {@code kubernetes} will use org.apache.catalina.tribes.KubernetesMembershipProvider
  • {@code dns} will use org.apache.catalina.tribes.DNSMembershipProvider
  • Class implementing {@code org.apache.catalina.tribes.MembershipProvider}

name: cas.authn.mfa.triggers.http.request-parameter
description: MFA can be triggered for a specific authentication request, provided the initial request to the CAS /login endpoint contains a parameter that indicates the required MFA authentication flow. The parameter name is configurable, but its value must match the authentication provider id of an available MFA provider.

name: cas.saml-sp.zimbra.attributes

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.base-dn
description: Base DN to use. There may be scenarios where different parts of a single LDAP tree could be considered as base-dns. Rather than duplicating the LDAP configuration block for each individual base-dn, each entry can be specified and joined together using a special delimiter character. The user DN is retrieved using the combination of all base-dn and DN resolvers in the order defined. DN resolution should fail if multiple DNs are found. Otherwise the first DN found is returned. Usual syntax is: {@code subtreeA,dc=example,dc=net|subtreeC,dc=example,dc=net}.

  • {@code DENY}: Deny authentication and block.
  • {@code THRESHOLD}: Applicable to CRL expiration, throttle the request whereby expired data is permitted up to a threshold period of time but not afterward.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.jpa.fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

name: cas.authn.x509.revocation-checker
description:
Revocation certificate checking can be carried out in one of the following ways:
  • {@code NONE}: No revocation is performed.
  • {@code CRL}: The CRL URI(s) mentioned in the certificate cRLDistributionPoints extension field. Caches are available to prevent excessive IO against CRL endpoints. CRL data is fetched if does not exist in the cache or if it is expired.
  • {@code RESOURCE}: A CRL hosted at a fixed location. The CRL is fetched at periodic intervals and cached.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.okta.private-key.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.search-filter

You may also provide an external groovy script in the syntax of {@code file:/path/to/GroovyScript.groovy} to fully build the final filter template dynamically.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.core.backup-count
description: To provide data safety, Hazelcast allows you to specify the number of backup copies you want to have. That way, data on a cluster member will be copied onto other member(s). To create synchronous backups, select the number of backup copies. When this count is 1, a map entry will have its backup on one other member in the cluster. If you set it to 2, then a map entry will have its backup on two other members. You can set it to 0 if you do not want your entries to be backed up, e.g., if performance is more important than backing up. The maximum value for the backup count is 6. Sync backup operations have a blocking cost which may lead to latency issues.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.core.replicated
description:
A Replicated Map is a distributed key-value data structure where the data is replicated to all members in the cluster. It provides full replication of entries to all members for high speed access. A Replicated Map does not partition data (it does not spread data to different cluster members); instead, it replicates the data to all members. Replication leads to higher memory consumption. However, a Replicated Map has faster read and write access since the data is available on all members. Writes could take place on local/remote members in order to provide write-order, eventually being replicated to all other members.

If you have a large cluster or very high occurrences of updates, the Replicated Map may not scale linearly as expected since it has to replicate update operations to all members in the cluster. Since the replication of updates is performed in an asynchronous manner, Hazelcast recommends you enable back pressure in case your system has high occurrences of updates.

Note that Replicated Map does not guarantee eventual consistency because there are some edge cases that fail to provide consistency.

Replicated Map uses the internal partition system of Hazelcast in order to serialize updates happening on the same key at the same time. This happens by sending updates of the same key to the same Hazelcast member in the cluster.

Due to the asynchronous nature of replication, a Hazelcast member could die before successfully replicating a "write" operation to other members after sending the "write completed" response to its caller during the write process. In this scenario, Hazelcast’s internal partition system promotes one of the replicas of the partition as the primary one. The new primary partition does not have the latest "write" since the dead member could not successfully replicate the update.

name: cas.authn.mfa.radius.rank
description:
At times, CAS needs to determine the correct provider when step-up authentication is required. Consider for a moment that CAS already has established an SSO session with/without a provider and has reached a level of authentication. Another incoming request attempts to exercise that SSO session with a different and often competing authentication requirement that may differ from the authentication level CAS has already established. Concretely, examples may be:
  • CAS has achieved an SSO session, but a separate request now requires step-up authentication with DuoSecurity.
  • CAS has achieved an SSO session with an authentication level satisfied by DuoSecurity, but a separate request now requires step-up authentication with YubiKey.
In certain scenarios, CAS will attempt to rank authentication levels and compare them with each other. If CAS already has achieved a level that is higher than what the incoming request requires, no step-up authentication will be performed. If the opposite is true, CAS will route the authentication flow to the required authentication level and upon success, will adjust the SSO session with the new higher authentication level now satisfied. Ranking of authentication methods is done per provider via specific properties for each. Note that the higher the rank value is, the higher on the security scale it remains. A provider that ranks higher with a larger weight value trumps and override others with a lower value.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.redis.share-native-connections
description: The shared native connection is never closed by Lettuce connection, therefore it is not validated by default when connections are retrieved. If this setting is {@code true}, a shared connection will be used for regular operations and a connection provider will be used to select a connection for blocking and tx operations only, which should not share a connection. If native connection sharing is disabled, new (or pooled) connections will be used for all operations. By default, multiple connections share a single thread-safe native connection. If you enable connection pooling, then native connection sharing will be disabled and the connection pool will be used for all operations. You may however explicitly control connection sharing via this setting as an override.

name: cas.ticket.registry.memcached.kryo-registration-required
description:
If true, an exception is thrown when an unregistered class is encountered.

If false, when an unregistered class is encountered, its fully qualified class name will be serialized and the default serializer for the class used to serialize the object. Subsequent appearances of the class within the same object graph are serialized as an int id. Registered classes are serialized as an int id, avoiding the overhead of serializing the class name, but have the drawback of needing to know the classes to be serialized up front. See {@code ComponentSerializationPlan} for help here.

description: A replica set in MongoDB is a group of {@code mongod} processes that maintain the same data set. Replica sets provide redundancy and high availability, and are the basis for all production deployments.

name: cas.logout.redirect-url
description: A url to which CAS must immediately redirect after all logout operations have completed. Typically useful in scenarios where CAS is acting as a proxy and needs to redirect to an external identity provider's logout endpoint in order to remove a session, etc.

name: cas.geo-location.google-maps.client-secret
description: Authenticate into google maps via a client secret.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.mongo.password
description: MongoDb database password for authentication.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.pool.num-tests-per-eviction-run
description: Sets the maximum number of objects to examine during each run (if any) of the idle object evictor thread. When positive, the number of tests performed for a run will be the minimum of the configured value and the number of idle instances in the pool. When negative, the number of tests performed will be ceil(getNumIdle()/ abs(getNumTestsPerEvictionRun())) which means that when the value is -n roughly one nth of the idle objects will be tested per run.

name: cas.service-registry.cosmos-db.key
description: Document Db master key.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].allow-multiple-dns
description:
Whether search/query results are allowed to match on multiple DNs,
or whether a single unique DN is expected for the result.

name: cas.sms-provider.twilio.account-id
description: Twilio account identifier used for authentication.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.dropbox.css-class
description: CSS class that should be assigned to this client.

name: cas.saml-sp.zimbra.name-id-attribute
description: Attribute to use when generating nameids for this SP.

name: cas.audit.jdbc.isolate-internal-queries
description:
This property determines whether data source isolates internal pool queries, such as the connection alive test, in their own transaction.

Since these are typically read-only queries, it is rarely necessary to encapsulate them in their own transaction. This property only applies if {@link #autocommit} is disabled.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.pool.test-while-idle
description: Returns whether objects sitting idle in the pool will be validated by the idle object evictor ( if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be removed from the pool and destroyed.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].state
description: Whether attribute resolution based on this source is enabled.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.grouper.subject-type
description:
Indicate how the username passed to the attribute repository should be set and treated by the grouper client to look up records.

Accepted values are: {@code SUBJECT_IDENTIFIER}, {@code SUBJECT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME}, {@code SUBJECT_ID}.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.validator.scope
description: Search scope to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.bypass.rest.headers
description: Headers, defined as a Map, to include in the request when making the REST call. Will overwrite any header that CAS is pre-defined to send and include in the request. Key in the map should be the header name and the value in the map should be the header value.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.bind-credential
description: The bind credential to use when connecting to LDAP.

name: cas.authn.mfa.authy.bypass.rest.basic-auth-username
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the username for authentication.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.redis[].cluster.nodes.replica-of
description: Set the id of the master node.

name: cas.logout.confirm-logout
description: Before logout, allow the option to confirm on the web interface.

name: cas.server.tomcat.http
description: Embedded container HTTP port settings as an additional option.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].primary-group-id.base-dn
description: The Base dn.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.pool.max-size
description: Controls the maximum number of connections to keep in the pool, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.cluster.max-redirects
description: The max number of redirects to follow.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.sasl-realm
description: The SASL realm.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].idle-time
description:
Removes connections from the pool based on how long they have been idle in the available queue.
Prunes connections that have been idle for more than the indicated amount.

name: cas.sms-provider.sns.credential-access-key
description: Use access-key provided by AWS to authenticate.

name: cas.audit.jdbc.pool.min-size
description: Controls the minimum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].recursive.search-attribute
description: The Search attribute.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.pool.name
description: Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.ca-certificate
description: CA Authority certificate from Kubernetes Master. Defaults to reading the certificate from the auto-injected file at: {@code /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt}.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.rotation.schedule.start-delay
description: String representation of a start delay of loading data for a data store implementation. This is the delay between scheduler startup and first job’s execution

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.file-system.sign-metadata
description: Whether metadata generated on disk should be digitally signed. Signing operations use the saml2 identity provider's signing certificate and signing key.

name: cas.authn.mfa.duo[].failure-mode
description:
The failure mode policy for this MFA provider. The authentication policy by default supports fail-closed mode, which means that if you attempt to exercise a particular provider available to CAS and the provider cannot be reached, authentication will be stopped and an error will be displayed. You can of course change this behavior so that authentication proceeds without exercising the provider functionality, if that provider cannot respond. Each defined multifactor authentication provider can set its own failure mode policy. Failure modes set at this location will override the global failure mode, but defer to any failure mode set by the registered service. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code OPEN}: Disallow MFA, proceed with authentication but don't communicate MFA to the RP.
  • {@code CLOSED}: Disallow MFA, block with authentication.
  • {@code PHANTOM}: Disallow MFA, proceed with authentication and communicate MFA to the RP.
  • {@code NONE}: Do not check for failure at all.
  • {@code UNDEFINED}: The default one indicating that no failure mode is set at all.

name: cas.authn.cassandra.timeout
description: The request timeout. This defines how long the driver will wait for a given Cassandra node to answer a query.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.trust-manager
description:
Trust Manager options. Trust managers are responsible for managing the trust material that is used when making LDAP trust decisions, and for deciding whether credentials presented by a peer should be accepted. Accepted values are: *
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Enable and force the default JVM trust managers.
  • {@code ANY}: Trust any client or server.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.custom-params
description: Custom parameters to send along in authZ requests, etc.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].validate-on-checkout
description: Whether connections should be validated when loaned out from the pool.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.network.port-auto-increment
description: You may also want to choose to use only one port. In that case, you can disable the auto-increment feature of port.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.mongo.port
description: MongoDb database port.

name: cas.authn.mfa.duo[].registration.registration-url
description:
Link to a registration app, typically developed in-house
in order to allow new users to sign-up for duo functionality.
If the user account status requires enrollment and this link
is specified, CAS will redirect the authentication flow
to this registration app. Otherwise, the default duo mechanism
for new-user registrations shall take over.
Upon redirecting to the registration app, CAS would also build
a {@code principal} parameter into the registration URL, typically
in form of a JSON web token that conveys the user's identity. This JWT
can be signed and/or encrypted using settings defined via the {@link #getCrypto()}
configuration block here.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.pool.lifo
description: Returns whether the pool has LIFO (last in, first out) behaviour with respect to idle objects - always returning the most recently used object from the pool, or as a FIFO (first in, first out) queue, where the pool always returns the oldest object in the idle object pool.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].azure.max-clock-skew
description: Clock skew in order to account for drift, when validating id tokens.

name: cas.ticket.registry.redis.cache.cache-size
description: This cache size specifies the maximum number of entries the cache may contain. Note that the cache may evict an entry before this limit is exceeded or temporarily exceed the threshold while evicting. As the cache size grows close to the maximum, the cache evicts entries that are less likely to be used again. For example, the cache may evict an entry because it hasn't been used recently or very often. Note: to disable the cache, you may choose a cache size of {@code 0}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].assertion-consumer-service-index
description:
Allows the SAML client to select a specific ACS url from the metadata, if defined.
A negative value de-activates the selection process and is the default.

name: cas.events.jpa.pool.keep-alive-time
description: This property controls the keepalive interval for a connection in the pool. An in-use connection will never be tested by the keepalive thread, only when it is idle will it be tested. Default is zero, which disables this feature.

name: cas.saml-sp.cccco.name
description: Name of this service provider.

name: cas.authn.oidc.core.authentication-context-reference-mappings
description:
A mapping of authentication context refs (ACR) values. This is where specific authentication context classes are referenced and mapped to providers that CAS may support mainly for MFA purposes.

Example might be {@code acr-value->mfa-duo}.

name: cas.saml-sp.zendesk.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.saml-sp.emma.name-id-format
description: The forced nameId format to use when generating a response.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.linked-in.display-name
description: Indicate the title or display name of the client for decoration and client presentation purposes. If left blank, the client original name would be used by default.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.dynamo-db.local-instance
description: Indicates that the database instance is local to the deployment that does not require or use any credentials or other configuration other than host and region. This is mostly used during development and testing.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].password-field-name
description: Password column name.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.in-memory.scope
description:
Scope of map where the aup selection is stored. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code GLOBAL}: Store in global in-memory map (for life of server).
  • {@code AUTHENTICATION}: Store aup acceptance such that user is prompted when they authenticate via credentials.

name: cas.server.tomcat.socket.app-write-buf-size
description: Each connection that is opened up in Tomcat get associated with a write ByteBuffer. This attribute controls the size of this buffer. By default this write buffer is sized at 8192 bytes. For low concurrency you can increase this to buffer more response data. For an extreme amount of keep alive connections, decrease this number or increase your heap size. The default value here is pretty low, you should up it if you are not dealing with tens of thousands concurrent connections.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.resolve-not-ready-addresses
description: Defines if not ready addresses should be evaluated to be discovered on startup.

name: cas.server.prefix
description: A concatenation of the server name plus the CAS context path. Deployments at root likely need to blank out this value.

name: cas.events.jpa.autocommit
description: The default auto-commit behavior of connections in the pool. Determined whether queries such as update/insert should be immediately executed without waiting for an underlying transaction.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.crypto.enabled
description: Whether crypto operations are enabled.

name: cas.audit.redis.cluster.nodes
description: List of nodes available in the redis cluster.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.principal.principal-resolution-failure-fatal
description: When true, throws an error back indicating that principal resolution has failed and no principal can be found based on the authentication requirements. Otherwise, logs the condition as an error without raising a catastrophic error.

name: cas.spring.cloud.dynamo-db.connection-timeout
description: Connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].sign-service-provider-logout-request
description: Whether or not the Logout Request sent from the SP should be signed.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.mongo.pool.per-host
description: Total number of connections allowed per host.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.jpa.crypto.alg
description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].callback-url
description:
Callback URL to use to return the flow
back to the CAS server one the identity
provider is successfully done. This may be
used at the discretion of the client and its type
to build service parameters, redirect URIs, etc.
If none is specified, the CAS server's login endpoint
will be used as the basis of the final callback url.

name: cas.authn.spnego.properties[].cache-policy
description: Jcifs Netbios cache policy.

name: cas.spring.cloud.rest.basic-auth-password
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the password for authentication.

name: cas.audit.jdbc.date-formatter-pattern
description: Indicate the date formatter pattern used to fetch audit records from the database based on the record date. Default value is {@code yyyy-MM-dd 00:00:00.000000}.

name: cas.saml-sp.give-campus.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.authn.x509.webflow.enabled
description: Whether webflow auto-configuration should be enabled.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].pool.name

Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for
the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.saml-sp.neo-gov.name-id-format
description: The forced nameId format to use when generating a response.

name: cas.audit.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.network.ssl.trust-store-type
description: Type of the truststore. Its default value is JKS. Another commonly used type is the PKCS12. Available keystore/truststore types depend on your Operating system and the Java runtime.

name: cas.saml-sp.adobe-cloud.name
description: Name of this service provider.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.provisioning.rest.basic-auth-username
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the username for authentication.

name: cas.authn.throttle.jdbc.leak-threshold
description: Controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.windows-live.css-class
description: CSS class that should be assigned to this client.

name: cas.saml-sp.rocket-chat.name-id-attribute
description: Attribute to use when generating nameids for this SP.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.token.failure-mode
description:
The failure mode policy for this MFA provider. The authentication policy by default supports fail-closed mode, which means that if you attempt to exercise a particular provider available to CAS and the provider cannot be reached, authentication will be stopped and an error will be displayed. You can of course change this behavior so that authentication proceeds without exercising the provider functionality, if that provider cannot respond. Each defined multifactor authentication provider can set its own failure mode policy. Failure modes set at this location will override the global failure mode, but defer to any failure mode set by the registered service. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code OPEN}: Disallow MFA, proceed with authentication but don't communicate MFA to the RP.
  • {@code CLOSED}: Disallow MFA, block with authentication.
  • {@code PHANTOM}: Disallow MFA, proceed with authentication and communicate MFA to the RP.
  • {@code NONE}: Do not check for failure at all.
  • {@code UNDEFINED}: The default one indicating that no failure mode is set at all.

name: cas.authn.mongo.password-encoder.hash-length
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2}, it indicates the hash strength/length.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.principal.active-attribute-repository-ids

name: cas.acme.domain-key.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.crypto.enabled

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.events.core.enabled
description: Whether event tracking and recording functionality should be enabled.

name: cas.authn.throttle.jdbc.default-schema

name: cas.authn.cloud-directory.directory-arn
description: Directory ARN.

name: cas.authn.oidc.discovery.response-modes-supported
description: Supported response modes.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.rest.basic-auth-username
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the username for authentication.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].validate-periodically

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.s3.proxy-username

name: cas.warning-cookie.secure
description: True if sending this cookie should be restricted to a secure protocol, or false if the it can be sent using any protocol.

name: cas.saml-sp.zoom.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.oauth.session-replication.cookie.max-age
description: The maximum age of the cookie, specified in seconds. By default, {@code -1} indicating the cookie will persist until browser shutdown. A positive value indicates that the cookie will expire after that many seconds have passed. Note that the value is the maximum age when the cookie will expire, not the cookie's current age. A negative value means that the cookie is not stored persistently and will be deleted when the Web browser exits. A zero value causes the cookie to be deleted.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.redis.sentinel.node
description: list of host:port pairs.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].primary-group-id.group-filter

name: cas.audit.redis.cluster.adaptive-topology-refresh
description: Whether adaptive topology refreshing using all available refresh triggers should be used.

name: cas.saml-sp.poll-everywhere.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].propagation-behavior-name
description: Defines the propagation behavior for transactions.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.cluster.nodes[].replica-of
description: Set the id of the master node.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].case-change.dn-case-change
description: The Dn case change.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.password
description: Login password of the redis server.

name: cas.authn.cassandra.serial-consistency-level
description: Query option serial consistency level. The serial consistency level set through this method will be use for queries that don't explicitly have a serial consistency level. Accepted values are:{@code ALL, ANY, EACH_QUORUM, LOCAL_ONE, LOCAL_QUORUM, LOCAL_SERIAL, ONE, QUORUM, SERIAL, THREE, TWO}.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.replication-name
description: Name of this replication group.

name: cas.account-registration.core.registration-properties.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].keystore
description:
Path to the keystore used for SSL connections.
Typically contains SSL certificates for the LDAP server.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].max-pool-size
description: Maximum LDAP connection pool size which the pool can use to grow.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.pod-label-value
description: Defines the pod label value to lookup through the Service Discovery REST API of Kubernetes.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.syncope.order
description: The order of this attribute repository in the chain of repositories. Can be used to explicitly position this source in chain and affects merging strategies.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.jpa.pool.maximum-lifetime
description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool. When a connection reaches this timeout, even if recently used, it will be retired from the pool. An in-use connection will never be retired, only when it is idle will it be removed.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.dynamo-db.prevent-table-creation-on-startup
description: Flag that indicates whether to prevent CAS from creating tables.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.primary-group-id.base-dn
description: The Base dn.

name: cas.authn.pm.history.core.enabled
description: Flag to indicate if password history tracking is enabled.

name: cas.saml-sp.warp-wire.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.radius.bypass.authentication-method-name
description: Skip multifactor authentication depending on method/form of primary authentication execution. Specifically, skip multifactor if the authentication method attribute collected as part of authentication metadata matches a certain value.

name: cas.sms-provider.rest.url
description: The endpoint URL to contact and retrieve attributes.

name: cas.audit.jdbc.default-schema
description: Qualify unqualified table names with the given schema/tablespace in generated SQL.

name: cas.tgc.name
description: Cookie name. Constructs a cookie with a specified name and value. The name must conform to RFC 2965. That means it can contain only ASCII alphanumeric characters and cannot contain commas, semicolons, or white space or begin with a {@code $} character. The cookie's name cannot be changed after creation. By default, cookies are created according to the RFC 2965 cookie specification. Cookie names are automatically calculated assigned by CAS at runtime, and there is usually no need to customize the name or assign it a different value unless a special use case warrants the change.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.redis.cluster.nodes[].replica-of
description: Set the id of the master node.

name: cas.authn.policy.rest[].basic-auth-username
description:
If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication,
specify the username for authentication.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.mongo.pool.life-time
description: The maximum time a pooled connection can live for.  A zero value indicates no limit to the life time.  A pooled connection that has exceeded its life time will be closed and replaced when necessary by a new connection.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.validator.search-filter
description: Search filter to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.saml-sp.pager-duty.entity-ids

Skip multifactor authentication depending on method/form of primary authentication execution.
Specifically, skip multifactor if the authentication method attribute collected as part of
authentication metadata matches a certain value.

description: Indicate the title or display name of the client for decoration and client presentation purposes. If left blank, the client original name would be used by default.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.jpa.data-source-name

name: cas.authn.redis.sentinel.master
description: Name of Redis server.

name: cas.monitor.memcached.kryo-registration-required
description:
If true, an exception is thrown when an unregistered class is encountered.

If false, when an unregistered class is encountered, its fully qualified class name will be serialized and the default serializer for the class used to serialize the object. Subsequent appearances of the class within the same object graph are serialized as an int id. Registered classes are serialized as an int id, avoiding the overhead of serializing the class name, but have the drawback of needing to know the classes to be serialized up front. See {@code ComponentSerializationPlan} for help here.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.profile-path
description: Profile path.

name: cas.saml-sp.app-dynamics.name-id-format
description: The forced nameId format to use when generating a response.

name: cas.authn.spnego.properties[].jcifs-domain
description: The Jcifs domain.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.jpa.isolate-internal-queries
description:
This property determines whether data source isolates internal pool queries, such as the connection alive test, in their own transaction.

Since these are typically read-only queries, it is rarely necessary to encapsulate them in their own transaction. This property only applies if {@link #autocommit} is disabled.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].pool-passivator
description:
You may receive unexpected LDAP failures, when CAS is configured to authenticate using {@code DIRECT} or {@code AUTHENTICATED} types and LDAP is locked down to not allow anonymous binds/searches. Every second attempt with a given LDAP connection from the pool would fail if it was on the same connection as a failed login attempt, and the regular connection validator would similarly fail. When a connection is returned back to a pool, it still may contain the principal and credentials from the previous attempt. Before the next bind attempt using that connection, the validator tries to validate the connection again but fails because it’s no longer trying with the configured bind credentials but with whatever user DN was used in the previous step. Given the validation failure, the connection is closed and CAS would deny access by default. Passivators attempt to reconnect to LDAP with the configured bind credentials, effectively resetting the connection to what it should be after each bind request. Furthermore if you are seeing errors in the logs that resemble a 'Operation exception encountered, reopening connection' type of message, this usually is an indication that the connection pool’s validation timeout established and created by CAS is greater than the timeout configured in the LDAP server, or more likely, in the load balancer in front of the LDAP servers. You can adjust the LDAP server session’s timeout for connections, or you can teach CAS to use a validity period that is equal or less than the LDAP server session’s timeout. Accepted values are:
  • {@code NONE}: No passivation takes place.
  • {@code BIND}: The default behavior which passivates a connection by performing a bind operation on it. This option requires the availability of bind credentials when establishing connections to LDAP.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.follow-referrals

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].metadata.service-provider.jdbc.ddl-auto
description:
Hibernate feature to automatically validate and exports DDL to the schema. By default, creates and drops the schema automatically when a session is starts and ends. Setting the value to {@code validate} or {@code none} may be more desirable for production, but any of the following options can be used:
  • {@code validate}: Validate the schema, but make no changes to the database.
  • {@code update}: Update the schema.
  • {@code create}: Create the schema, destroying previous data.
  • {@code create-drop}: Drop the schema at the end of the session.
  • {@code none}: Do nothing.

Note that during a version migration where any schema has changed {@code create-drop} will result in the loss of all data as soon as CAS is started. For transient data like tickets this is probably not an issue, but in cases like the audit table important data could be lost. Using `update`, while safe for data, is confirmed to result in invalid database state. {@code validate} or {@code none} settings are likely the only safe options for production use.

For more info, see this.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].type
description:
The type of search entry handler to choose. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_REFERRAL}: Provides handling of an ldap referral for search operations.
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_RESULT_REFERENCE}: Provides handling of an ldap continuation reference for search operations.
  • {@code ACTIVE_DIRECTORY}: Process the entry results fetched from active directory and check for account status controls for disabled/expired accounts, etc.
  • {@code OBJECT_GUID}: Object guid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectGUID} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code OBJECT_SID}: Object sid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectSid} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code CASE_CHANGE}: Case change search entry handler. Provides the ability to modify the case of search entry DNs, attribute names, and attribute values.
  • {@code DN_ATTRIBUTE_ENTRY}: DN attribute entry handler. Adds the entry DN as an attribute to the result set. Provides a client side implementation of RFC 5020.
  • {@code MERGE}: Merge search entry handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes into a single attribute.
  • {@code PRIMARY_GROUP}: Primary group search handler. Constructs the primary group SID and then searches for that group and puts it's DN in the {@code memberOf} attribute of the original search entry.
  • {@code RANGE_ENTRY}: Range entry search handler. Rewrites attributes returned from Active Directory to include all values by performing additional searches.
  • {@code RECURSIVE_ENTRY}: Recursive entry search handler. This recursively searches based on a supplied attribute and merges those results into the original entry.
  • {@code MERGE_ENTRIES}: Merge entries handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes in all entries into a single attribute. The merged attribute may or may not already exist on the entry. If it does exist it's existing values will remain intact.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.share-native-connections
description: The shared native connection is never closed by Lettuce connection, therefore it is not validated by default when connections are retrieved. If this setting is {@code true}, a shared connection will be used for regular operations and a connection provider will be used to select a connection for blocking and tx operations only, which should not share a connection. If native connection sharing is disabled, new (or pooled) connections will be used for all operations. By default, multiple connections share a single thread-safe native connection. If you enable connection pooling, then native connection sharing will be disabled and the connection pool will be used for all operations. You may however explicitly control connection sharing via this setting as an override.

The user DN is retrieved using the combination of all base-dn and DN resolvers in the order defined. DN resolution should fail if multiple DNs are found. Otherwise the first DN found is returned. Usual syntax is: {@code subtreeA,dc=example,dc=net|subtreeC,dc=example,dc=net}.
