Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].azure.response-type
description:
The response type tells the authorization server which grant to execute.
For backward compatibility the default value is empty, which means the default pac4j ("code") response type is used.
Possibles values includes "code", "token" or "id_token".

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.block-wait-time
description: The length of time the pool will block. By default the pool will block indefinitely and there is no guarantee that waiting threads will be serviced in the order in which they made their request. This option should be used with a blocking connection pool when you need to control the exact number of connections that can be created

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.multicast.enabled
description: Enables a multicast configuration using a group address and port. Contains the configuration for the multicast discovery mechanism. With the multicast discovery mechanism Hazelcast allows Hazelcast members to find each other using multicast. So Hazelcast members do not need to know concrete addresses of members, they just multicast to everyone listening. It depends on your environment if multicast is possible or allowed; otherwise you need to have a look at the tcp/ip cluster

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].trust-store
description:
Path to the keystore used to determine which certificates or
certificate authorities should be trusted.
Used when connecting to an LDAP server via LDAPS or startTLS connection.
If left blank, the default truststore for the Java runtime is used.

name: cas.authn.oidc.webfinger.user-info.rest.method
description: HTTP method to use when contacting the rest endpoint. Examples include {@code GET, POST}, etc.

name: cas.server.tomcat.socket.performance-latency
description: An int expressing the relative importance of low latency. Performance preferences are described by three integers whose values indicate the relative importance of short connection time, low latency, and high bandwidth. The absolute values of the integers are irrelevant; in order to choose a protocol the values are compared, with larger values indicating stronger preferences. Negative values disable the setting. If the application prefers short connection time over both low latency and high bandwidth, for example, then it could invoke this method with the values (1, 0, 0). If the application prefers high bandwidth above low latency, and low latency above short connection time, then it could invoke this method with the values (0, 1, 2).

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.manager-type
description: Accepted values are: {@code DELTA, BACKUP}. Enable all-to-all session replication using the DeltaManager to replicate session deltas. By all-to-all we mean that the session gets replicated to all the other nodes in the cluster. This works great for smaller cluster but we don't recommend it for larger clusters(a lot of Tomcat nodes). Also when using the delta manager it will replicate to all nodes, even nodes that don't have the application deployed. To get around this problem, you'll want to use the BackupManager. This manager only replicates the session data to one backup node, and only to nodes that have the application deployed. Downside of the BackupManager: not quite as battle tested as the delta manager.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.core.expire-registrations
description: Expire and forget device registration requests after this period.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.core.map-merge-policy
description:
Define how data items in Hazelcast maps are merged together from source to destination. By default, merges map entries from source to destination if they don't exist in the destination map. Accepted values are:
  • {@code PUT_IF_ABSENT}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination if they don't exist in the destination data structure.
  • {@code HIGHER_HITS}: * Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry has more hits than the destination one.
  • {@code DISCARD}: Merges only entries from the destination data structure and discards all entries from the source data structure.
  • {@code PASS_THROUGH}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination directly unless the merging entry is null
  • {@code EXPIRATION_TIME}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry will expire later than the destination entry. This policy can only be used if the clocks of the nodes are in sync.
  • {@code LATEST_UPDATE}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry was updated more frequently than the destination entry. This policy can only be used if the clocks of the nodes are in sync.
  • {@code LATEST_ACCESS}: Merges data structure entries from source to destination data structure if the source entry has been accessed more recently than the destination entry. This policy can only be used if the clocks of the nodes are in sync.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.jdbc.fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

If no mapping is specified, CAS defaults will be used instead.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].type
description:
The type of search entry handler to choose. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_REFERRAL}: Provides handling of an ldap referral for search operations.
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_RESULT_REFERENCE}: Provides handling of an ldap continuation reference for search operations.
  • {@code ACTIVE_DIRECTORY}: Process the entry results fetched from active directory and check for account status controls for disabled/expired accounts, etc.
  • {@code OBJECT_GUID}: Object guid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectGUID} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code OBJECT_SID}: Object sid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectSid} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code CASE_CHANGE}: Case change search entry handler. Provides the ability to modify the case of search entry DNs, attribute names, and attribute values.
  • {@code DN_ATTRIBUTE_ENTRY}: DN attribute entry handler. Adds the entry DN as an attribute to the result set. Provides a client side implementation of RFC 5020.
  • {@code MERGE}: Merge search entry handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes into a single attribute.
  • {@code PRIMARY_GROUP}: Primary group search handler. Constructs the primary group SID and then searches for that group and puts it's DN in the {@code memberOf} attribute of the original search entry.
  • {@code RANGE_ENTRY}: Range entry search handler. Rewrites attributes returned from Active Directory to include all values by performing additional searches.
  • {@code RECURSIVE_ENTRY}: Recursive entry search handler. This recursively searches based on a supplied attribute and merges those results into the original entry.
  • {@code MERGE_ENTRIES}: Merge entries handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes in all entries into a single attribute. The merged attribute may or may not already exist on the entry. If it does exist it's existing values will remain intact.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.network.ssl.trust-store-password
description: Password to unlock the truststore file.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.network.ssl.mutual-authentication
description:
Mutual authentication configuration. It’s empty by default which means the client side of connection is not authenticated. Available values are:
  • {@code REQUIRED} - server forces usage of a trusted client certificate
  • {@code OPTIONAL} - server asks for a client certificate, but it doesn’t require it

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.core.async-fillup
description:
Used when replication is turned on with {@link #isReplicated()}.

If a new member joins the cluster, there are two ways you can handle the initial provisioning that is executed to replicate all existing values to the new member. Each involves how you configure the async fill up.

  • First, you can configure async fill up to true, which does not block reads while the fill up operation is underway. That way, you have immediate access on the new member, but it will take time until all the values are eventually accessible. Not yet replicated values are returned as non-existing (null).
  • Second, you can configure for a synchronous initial fill up (by configuring the async fill up to false), which blocks every read or write access to the map until the fill up operation is finished. Use this with caution since it might block your application from operating.

name: cas.authn.oauth.uma.resource-set.jpa.pool.suspension
description:
Whether or not pool suspension is allowed.

There is a performance impact when pool suspension is enabled. Unless you need it (for a redundancy system for example) do not enable it.

name: cas.authn.oauth.device-user-code.user-code-length
description: Length of the generated user code.

name: cas.saml-sp.arc-g-i-s.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.authn.soap.password-encoder.iterations
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the required number of iterations.

name: cas.authn.throttle.bucket4j.bandwidth
description: Describe the available bandwidth and the overall limitations. Multiple bandwidths allow for different policies per unit of measure. (i.e. allows 1000 tokens per 1 minute, but not often then 50 tokens per 1 second).

name: cas.authn.ldap[].max-pool-size
description: Maximum LDAP connection pool size which the pool can use to grow.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].batch-maximum-delay-milliseconds
description:
Maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, to be waited before
sending a batch of events in case batch.size is not reached.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mongo.collection
description: MongoDb database collection name to fetch and/or create.

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.consent.redis.timeout
description: Command timeout.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.azure-active-directory[].case-insensitive
description:
Whether attribute repository should consider the underlying
attribute names in a case-insensitive manner.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.validator.scope
description: Search scope to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.saml-sp.infinite-campus.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oauth2
description: Settings that deal with having OAuth2-capable providers as an external delegated-to authentication provider.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].password-encoder.strength
description:
Strength or number of iterations to use for password hashing.
Usually relevant when dealing with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT}.
When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the salt strength.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.sql-update-security-questions
description: SQL query to update security questions for the account, if any.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].keystore-password
description: Keystore password.

name: cas.webflow.auto-configuration.order
description: The order in which the webflow is configured.

name: cas.standalone.configuration-security.psw
description: Secret key/password to use when deciphering settings.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.network.public-address
description: The default public address to be advertised to other cluster members and clients.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.algs.override-signature-canonicalization-algorithm
description: The Override signature canonicalization algorithm.

name: cas.account-registration.sms.from
description: The from address for the message.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.propagation-behavior-name
description: Defines the propagation behavior for transactions. @see org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition

name: cas.saml-sp.salesforce.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.multicast.trusted-interfaces
description: Multicast trusted interfaces for discovery. With the multicast auto-discovery mechanism, Hazelcast allows cluster members to find each other using multicast communication. The cluster members do not need to know the concrete addresses of the other members, as they just multicast to all the other members for listening. Whether multicast is possible or allowed depends on your environment.

name: cas.authn.throttle.jdbc.fetch-size
description: Used to specify number of rows to be fetched in a select query.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.mongo.pool.min-size
description: Minimum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.drop-tables-on-startup
description: Flag that indicates whether to drop tables on start up.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.core.device-registration-enabled
description: Indicates whether CAS should ask for device registration consent or execute it automatically.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.binary-attributes
description: Indicate the collection of attributes that are to be tagged and processed as binary attributes by the underlying search resolver.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].validator.base-dn
description: Base DN to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.cassandra.contact-points
description: The list of contact points to use for the new cluster. Each contact point should be defined using the syntax {@code address:port}.

name: cas.saml-sp.concur-solutions.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.mongo.socket-keep-alive
description: Whether the database socket connection should be tagged with keep-alive.

name: cas.authn.mongo.name
description: Name of the authentication handler.

name: cas.authn.oauth.csrf-cookie.same-site-policy
description:
If a cookie is only intended to be accessed in a first party context, the developer has the option to apply one of settings {@code SameSite=Lax} or {@code SameSite=Strict} or {@code SameSite=None} to prevent external access.

To safeguard more websites and their users, the new secure-by-default model assumes all cookies should be protected from external access unless otherwise specified. Developers must use a new cookie setting, {@code SameSite=None}, to designate cookies for cross-site access. When the {@code SameSite=None} attribute is present, an additional {@code Secure} attribute is used so cross-site cookies can only be accessed over HTTPS connections.

Accepted values are:
  • {@code Lax}
  • {@code Strict}
  • {@code None}
  • {@code Off}: Disable the generation of the SameSite cookie attribute altogether.
  • Path to a Groovy script that is able to generate the SameSite cookie attribute dynamically.
  • Fully qualified name of a class that implements {@code org.apereo.cas.web.cookie.CookieSameSitePolicy}

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.logout.sign-logout-response
description: Whether SLO logout responses are required to be signed.

name: cas.authn.token.principal-transformation.case-conversion
description:
Indicate whether the principal identifier should be transformed into upper-case, lower-case, etc. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code NONE}: No conversion.
  • {@code LOWERCASE}: Lowercase conversion.
  • {@code UPPERCASE}: Uppercase conversion.

name: cas.saml-sp.workday.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.authn.oidc.core.accepted-issuers-pattern
description: Defines the regular expression pattern that is matched against the calculated issuer from the request. If the issuer that is extracted from the request does not match the {@link #issuer} defined in the CAS configuration, this pattern acts as a secondary level rule to allow incoming requests to pass through if the match is successful. By default, the pattern is designed to never match anything.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].certificate-signature-alg
description:
Certificate signature algorithm to use
when generating the certificate.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].google.css-class
description: CSS class that should be assigned to this client.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.sasl-authorization-id
description: SASL authorization id.

name: cas.authn.oauth.session-replication.replicate-sessions
description: Indicates whether profiles and other session data, collected as part of authentication flows and protocol requests that are kept by the container session, should be replicated across the cluster using CAS and its own ticket registry. Without this option, profile data and other related pieces of information should be manually replicated via means and libraries outside of CAS.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.mongo.read-concern
description:
Read concern. Accepted values are:
  • {@code LOCAL}
  • {@code MAJORITY}
  • {@code LINEARIZABLE}
  • {@code SNAPSHOT}
  • {@code AVAILABLE}

name: cas.authn.wsfed-idp.sts.encryption-keystore-file
description: Keystore path used to encrypt tokens.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.core.cp-member-count
description: CP Subsystem is a component of a Hazelcast cluster that builds a strongly consistent layer for a set of distributed data structures. Its data structures are CP with respect to the CAP principle, i.e., they always maintain linearizability and prefer consistency over availability during network partitions. Besides network partitions, CP Subsystem withstands server and client failures. All members of a Hazelcast cluster do not necessarily take part in CP Subsystem. The number of Hazelcast members that take part in CP Subsystem is specified here. CP Subsystem must have at least 3 CP members.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.bitbucket.auto-redirect-type
description:
Auto-redirect to this client. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code SERVER}: Redirect on the server side, typically making CAS invisible.
  • {@code CLIENT}: Redirect on the client side using browser redirects, etc.
  • {@code NONE}: Do nothing and let the selection take place manually.

name: cas.consent.ldap.validator.scope
description: Search scope to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.jpa.pool.max-size
description: Controls the maximum number of connections to keep in the pool, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.token.name
description: The name of the authentication handler used to verify credentials in MFA. Remember that if you have more than one authentication handler of the same type, the names must be defined uniquely for each authentication scheme. Failing to do so may force CAS to not register authentication handlers with a duplicate name.

name: cas.authn.redis.pool.test-on-create
description: Returns whether objects created for the pool will be validated before being returned from the borrowObject() method. Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, then borrowObject() will fail.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].propagation-behavior-name
description: Defines the propagation behavior for transactions.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.jpa.pool.name
description: Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.bind[].name
description: Name of the authentication handler.

name: cas.authn.mfa.triggers.rest.method
description: HTTP method to use when contacting the rest endpoint. Examples include {@code GET, POST}, etc.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.enabled
description: Whether WAN should be enabled.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.jpa.data-source-name
description: Attempts to do a JNDI data source look up for the data source name specified. Will attempt to locate the data source object as is.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.port
description: Redis server port.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.batch-size
description: A non-zero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. e.g. recommended values between 5 and 30.

name: cas.authn.wsfed-idp.sts.crypto.alg
description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.consent.redis.pool.max-active
description: Max number of connections that can be allocated by the pool at a given time. Use a negative value for no limit.

name: cas.ticket.registry.redis.pool.test-on-return
description: Returns whether objects borrowed from the pool will be validated when they are returned to the pool via the returnObject() method. Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. Returning objects that fail validation are destroyed rather then being returned the pool.

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.default-catalog
description: Qualifies unqualified table names with the given catalog in generated SQL.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.jpa.batch-size
description: A non-zero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. e.g. recommended values between 5 and 30.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.json.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].idle-timeout
description: Controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool.

name: cas.saml-sp.in-common.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].block-wait-time
description:
The length of time the pool will block.
By default the pool will block indefinitely and there is no guarantee that
waiting threads will be serviced in the order in which they made their request.
This option should be used with a blocking connection pool when you need to control the exact
number of connections that can be created

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].pool.name
description:
Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for
the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.github.secret
description: The client secret.

name: cas.authn.mfa.duo[].duo-integration-key
description: Duo integration key.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.git.private-key.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.jpa.autocommit
description: The default auto-commit behavior of connections in the pool. Determined whether queries such as update/insert should be immediately executed without waiting for an underlying transaction.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.gcp.hz-port
description: A range of ports where the plugin looks for Hazelcast members.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.default-schema
description: Qualify unqualified table names with the given schema/tablespace in generated SQL.

name: cas.consent.ldap.search-entry-handlers
description: Search handlers.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.ssm.profile-path
description: Profile path.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.ldap-authz.group-prefix
description: A prefix that is prepended to the group attribute value to construct an authorized role.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].apple.expire-session-with-token
description: Checks if sessions expire with token expiration.

name: cas.saml-sp.benefit-focus.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.sso.services.allow-missing-service-parameter
description:
Flag that indicates whether to allow SSO session with a missing target service.

By default, CAS will present a generic success page if the initial authentication request does not identify the target application. In some cases, the ability to login to CAS without logging in to a particular service may be considered a misfeature because in practice, too few users and institutions are prepared to understand, brand, and support what is at best a fringe use case of logging in to CAS for the sake of establishing an SSO session without logging in to any CAS-reliant service.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.sasl-mechanism
description: The SASL mechanism.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.discovery.azure.tenant-id
description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID.

name: cas.audit.jdbc.user
description:
The database user.

The database user must have sufficient permissions to be able to handle schema changes and updates, when needed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.mongo.ssl-enabled
description: Whether connections require SSL.

name: cas.authn.throttle.bucket4j.blocking
description: Whether the request should block until capacity becomes available. Consume a token from the token bucket. If a token is not available this will block until the refill adds one to the bucket.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].isolate-internal-queries
description:
This property determines whether data source isolates internal pool queries, such as the connection alive test, in their own transaction.

Since these are typically read-only queries, it is rarely necessary to encapsulate them in their own transaction. This property only applies if {@link #autocommit} is disabled.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].cluster-name
description:
Sets the cluster name used as an endpoint group password for authentication
on the target endpoint.
If there is no separate publisher ID property defined, this cluster name
will also be used as a WAN publisher ID. This ID is then used for
identifying the publisher.

name: cas.authn.mfa.duo[].registration.crypto.alg
description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.sasl-quality-of-protection
description: SASL quality of protected.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oauth2[].secret
description: The client secret.

name: cas.ticket.registry.ignite.crypto.enabled
description: Whether crypto operations are enabled.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].connect-timeout
description: Sets the maximum amount of time that connects will block.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.base-dn
description: Base DN to use. There may be scenarios where different parts of a single LDAP tree could be considered as base-dns. Rather than duplicating the LDAP configuration block for each individual base-dn, each entry can be specified and joined together using a special delimiter character. The user DN is retrieved using the combination of all base-dn and DN resolvers in the order defined. DN resolution should fail if multiple DNs are found. Otherwise the first DN found is returned. Usual syntax is: {@code subtreeA,dc=example,dc=net|subtreeC,dc=example,dc=net}.

name: cas.authn.cognito.password-encoder.character-encoding
description: The encoding algorithm to use such as 'UTF-8'. Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].apple.timeout
description: Client secret expiration timeout.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.dynamo-db.table-name
description: The table name used and created by CAS to hold mfa trust definitions in DynamoDb.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.bucket4j.bandwidth[].capacity
description: Number of tokens/requests that can be used within the time window.

name: cas.saml-sp.yuja.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.authn.accept.password-policy.strategy
description:
Decide how authentication should handle password policy changes. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Default option to handle policy changes.
  • {@code GROOVY}: Handle account password policies via Groovy.
  • {@code REJECT_RESULT_CODE}: Strategy to only activate password policy if the authentication response code is not blocked.

name: cas.consent.mongo.database-name
description: MongoDb database instance name.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.validator.search-filter
description: Search filter to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.mongo.authentication-database-name
description: Name of the database to use for authentication.

name: cas.server.tomcat.ext-access-log.directory
description: Directory name for extended log.

name: cas.authn.cognito.use-reaper
description: Flag that indicates whether to use reaper.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.mongo.pool.life-time
description: The maximum time a pooled connection can live for.  A zero value indicates no limit to the life time.  A pooled connection that has exceeded its life time will be closed and replaced when necessary by a new connection.

name: cas.authn.cognito.client-execution-timeout
description: Client execution timeout.

name: cas.authn.spnego.principal-transformation.blocking-pattern
description: A regular expression that will be used against the username to match for blocking/forbidden values. If a match is found, an exception will be thrown and principal transformation will fail.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.google.id
description: The client id.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.yahoo.principal-id-attribute
description: The attribute found in the identity provider response that may be used to establish the authenticated user and build a profile for CAS.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.network.ssl.trust-manager-algorithm
description: Name of the algorithm based on which the trust managers are provided.

name: cas.ticket.registry.memcached.shutdown-timeout-seconds
description: The number of seconds to wait for connections to finish before shutting down the client.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.name
description: Name of the LDAP handler.

name: cas.authn.mfa.triggers.principal.global-principal-attribute-name-triggers
description:
MFA can be triggered for all users/subjects carrying a specific attribute that matches one of the conditions below.
  • Trigger MFA based on a principal attribute(s) whose value(s) matches a regex pattern. Note that this behavior is only applicable if there is only a single MFA provider configured, since that would allow CAS to know what provider to next activate.
  • Trigger MFA based on a principal attribute(s) whose value(s) EXACTLY matches an MFA provider. This option is more relevant if you have more than one provider configured or if you have the flexibility of assigning provider ids to attributes as values.
Needless to say, the attributes need to have been resolved for the principal prior to this step. Matching and comparison operations are case insensitive.

name: cas.authn.azure-active-directory.password-encoder.encoding-algorithm
description: The encoding algorithm to use such as {@code MD5}. Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT} or {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}. When used with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it should be one of {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1}, {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256} or {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA512}.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].merge-attribute.merge-attribute-name
description: The Merge attribute name.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.pool.timeout-millis
description: The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will wait for a connection to be validated as alive.

name: cas.account-registration.core.password-policy-pattern
description: A String value representing password policy regex pattern. Minimum 8 and Maximum 10 characters at least 1 Uppercase Alphabet, 1 Lowercase Alphabet, 1 Number and 1 Special Character.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.amazon-s3.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].azure.secret
description: The client secret.

name: cas.authn.mfa.authy.bypass.rest.headers
description: Headers, defined as a Map, to include in the request when making the REST call. Will overwrite any header that CAS is pre-defined to send and include in the request. Key in the map should be the header name and the value in the map should be the header value.

name: cas.person-directory.use-existing-principal-id
description: Uses an existing principal id that may have already been established in order to run person directory queries. This is generally useful in situations where authentication is delegated to an external identity provider and a principal is first established to then query an attribute source.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.rest.method
description: HTTP method to use when contacting the rest endpoint. Examples include {@code GET, POST}, etc.

name: cas.ticket.registry.cosmos-db.max-retry-wait-time
description: Sets the maximum retry time in seconds. When a request fails due to a throttle error, the service sends back a response that contains a value indicating the client should not retry before the time period has elapsed (Retry-After). The MaxRetryWaitTime flag allows the application to set a maximum wait time for all retry attempts. If the cumulative wait time exceeds the MaxRetryWaitTime, the SDK will stop retrying and return the error to the application.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.bind[].physical-naming-strategy-class-name
description: Fully-qualified name of the class that can control the physical naming strategy of hibernate.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.trust-store-type
description: The type of trust keystore that determines which certificates or certificate authorities are trusted. Types depend on underlying java platform, typically {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.saml-sp.sa-manage.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.throttle.jdbc.isolation-level-name
description: Defines the isolation level for transactions. @see org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.bypass.authentication-attribute-name
description: Skip multifactor authentication based on designated authentication attribute names.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.validator.attribute-value
description: Attribute values to use for the compare validator.

name: cas.authn.oauth.access-token.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].primary-group-id.group-filter
description: The Group filter.

name: cas.authn.soap.password-encoder.encoding-algorithm
description: The encoding algorithm to use such as {@code MD5}. Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT} or {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}. When used with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it should be one of {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1}, {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256} or {@code PBKDF2WithHmacSHA512}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.core.name
description: The name of the authentication handler in CAS used for delegation.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.redis.sentinel.node
description: list of host:port pairs.

name: cas.authn.json.password-policy.warning-days
description: This is used to calculate a warning period to see if account expiry is within the calculated window.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.base-dn
description: Base DN to use. There may be scenarios where different parts of a single LDAP tree could be considered as base-dns. Rather than duplicating the LDAP configuration block for each individual base-dn, each entry can be specified and joined together using a special delimiter character. The user DN is retrieved using the combination of all base-dn and DN resolvers in the order defined. DN resolution should fail if multiple DNs are found. Otherwise the first DN found is returned. Usual syntax is: {@code subtreeA,dc=example,dc=net|subtreeC,dc=example,dc=net}.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].pool.keep-alive-time
description:
This property controls the keepalive interval for a connection in the pool. An in-use connection
will never be tested by the keepalive thread, only when it is idle will it be tested.
Default is zero, which disables this feature.

name: cas.audit.dynamo-db.asynchronous
description: Make storage requests asynchronously.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.default-catalog
description: Qualifies unqualified table names with the given catalog in generated SQL.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.dynamo-db.credential-access-key
description: Use access-key provided by AWS to authenticate.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap
description: Options for password sync via LDAP.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.network.members
description: Sets the well known members. If members is empty, calling this method will have the same effect as calling {@code clear()}. A member can be a comma separated string, e..g {@code 10.11.12.1,10.11.12.2} which indicates multiple members are going to be added. The list of members must include ALL CAS server node, including the current node that owns this configuration.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.aws.tag-value
description: If a tag key/value is set, only instances with that tag key/value will be selected.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.ldap-authz.group-base-dn
description: Base DN to start the search looking for groups.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.core.session-replication.replicate-sessions
description: Indicates whether profiles and other session data, collected as part of authentication flows and protocol requests that are kept by the container session, should be replicated across the cluster using CAS and its own ticket registry. Without this option, profile data and other related pieces of information should be manually replicated via means and libraries outside of CAS.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.file-system.location
description: Directory location of SAML metadata and signing/encryption keys. This directory will be used to hold the configuration files.

name: cas.authn.pm.rest.field-name-user
description: Field name for username field when password change requests are submitted.

name: cas.authn.accept.password-policy.account-state-handling-enabled
description: Indicates whether account state handling should be enabled to process warnings or errors reported back from the authentication response, produced by the source.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].cluster-name
description:
Sets the cluster name used as an endpoint group password for authentication
on the target endpoint.
If there is no separate publisher ID property defined, this cluster name
will also be used as a WAN publisher ID. This ID is then used for
identifying the publisher.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].sasl-realm
description: The SASL realm.

name: cas.google-recaptcha.score
description: reCAPTCHA v3 returns a score (1.0 is very likely a good interaction, 0.0 is very likely a bot). reCAPTCHA learns by seeing real traffic on your site. For this reason, scores in a staging environment or soon after implementing may differ from production. As reCAPTCHA v3 doesn't ever interrupt the user flow, you can first run reCAPTCHA without taking action and then decide on thresholds by looking at your traffic in the admin console. By default, you can use a threshold of 0.5.

name: cas.authn.wsfed[].identity-attribute
description: The attribute extracted from the assertion and used to construct the CAS principal id.

name: cas.authn.cognito.region
description: AWS region used.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.aws.access-key
description: AWS access key.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.failure-mode
description:
The failure mode policy for this MFA provider. The authentication policy by default supports fail-closed mode, which means that if you attempt to exercise a particular provider available to CAS and the provider cannot be reached, authentication will be stopped and an error will be displayed. You can of course change this behavior so that authentication proceeds without exercising the provider functionality, if that provider cannot respond. Each defined multifactor authentication provider can set its own failure mode policy. Failure modes set at this location will override the global failure mode, but defer to any failure mode set by the registered service. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code OPEN}: Disallow MFA, proceed with authentication but don't communicate MFA to the RP.
  • {@code CLOSED}: Disallow MFA, block with authentication.
  • {@code PHANTOM}: Disallow MFA, proceed with authentication and communicate MFA to the RP.
  • {@code NONE}: Do not check for failure at all.
  • {@code UNDEFINED}: The default one indicating that no failure mode is set at all.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.core.max-no-heartbeat-seconds
description: Max timeout of heartbeat in seconds for a node to assume it is dead.

name: cas.authn.syncope.password-encoder.character-encoding
description: The encoding algorithm to use such as 'UTF-8'. Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].google.auto-redirect-type
description: Auto-redirect to this client.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.cluster.nodes[].host
description: Server's host address.

name: cas.service-registry.redis.pool.test-while-idle
description: Returns whether objects sitting idle in the pool will be validated by the idle object evictor ( if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be removed from the pool and destroyed.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].validate-period
description: Period at which pool should be validated.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.redis.username
description: Login username of the redis server.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.jpa.health-query
description: The SQL query to be executed to test the validity of connections. This is for "legacy" databases that do not support the JDBC4 {@code Connection.isValid()} API.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.pool.max-active
description: Max number of connections that can be allocated by the pool at a given time. Use a negative value for no limit.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.mongo.ssl-enabled
description: Whether connections require SSL.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.device-fingerprint.cookie.crypto.enabled
description: Whether crypto operations are enabled.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].executor-thread-count
description:
The number of threads that the replication executor will have. The executor is used to send WAN
events to the endpoints and ideally you want to have one thread per endpoint. If this property is omitted
and you have specified the endpoints property, this will be the case. If necessary you can manually define
the number of threads that the executor will use. Once the executor has been initialized there is thread
affinity between the discovered endpoints and the executor threads - all events for a single endpoint will
go through a single executor thread, preserving event order. It is important to determine which number of
executor threads is a good value. Failure to do so can lead to performance issues - either contention on a
too small number of threads or wasted threads that will not be performing any work.

name: cas.saml-sp.gitlab.description
description: Description of this service provider as it's stored in the registry.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.keystore-type
description: The type of keystore. {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.idle-time
description: Removes connections from the pool based on how long they have been idle in the available queue. Prunes connections that have been idle for more than the indicated amount.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mail.bcc
description: Email BCC address, if any.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.pool.test-on-borrow
description: Returns whether objects borrowed from the pool will be validated before being returned from the borrowObject() method. Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be removed from the pool and destroyed, and a new attempt will be made to borrow an object from the pool.

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.membership-address
description: Multicast address for membership. The multicast address that the membership will broadcast its presence and listen for other heartbeats on. The default value is 228.0.0.4 Make sure your network is enabled for multicast traffic. The multicast address, in conjunction with the port is what creates a cluster group. To divide up your farm into several different group, or to split up QA from production, change the port or the address

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.network.network-interfaces
description:
You can specify which network interfaces that Hazelcast should use. Servers mostly have more than one network interface, so you may want to list the valid IPs. Range characters ('*' and '-') can be used for simplicity. For instance, 10.3.10.* refers to IPs between 10.3.10.0 and 10.3.10.255. Interface 10.3.10.4-18 refers to IPs between 10.3.10.4 and 10.3.10.18 (4 and 18 included). If network interface configuration is enabled (it is disabled by default) and if Hazelcast cannot find an matching interface, then it will print a message on the console and will not start on that node.

Interfaces can be separated by a comma.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].metadata.service-provider.mongo.port
description: MongoDb database port.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.git.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.cluster.dynamic-refresh-sources
description: Whether to discover and query all cluster nodes for obtaining the cluster topology. When set to false, only the initial seed nodes are used as sources for topology discovery.

name: cas.audit.slf4j.singleline-separator
description: Character to separate audit fields if single-line audits are used.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.jpa.generate-statistics
description: Allow hibernate to generate query statistics.

name: cas.authn.radius.server.nas-ip-address
description: The NAS IP address.

name: cas.person-directory.attribute-resolution-enabled
description: Whether attribute repositories should be contacted to fetch person attributes. Defaults to true if not set.

name: cas.saml-sp.service-now.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.authn.adaptive.risk.response.sms.attribute-name
description: Principal attribute name that indicates the destination phone number for this SMS message. The attribute must already be resolved and available to the CAS principal.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.dn-attribute.dn-attribute-name
description: The Dn attribute name.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.validator.attribute-value
description: Attribute values to use for the compare validator.

name: cas.authn.accept.password-policy.warning-attribute-value
description: Used by an account state handling policy that only calculates account warnings in case the entry carries an attribute {@link #warningAttributeName} whose value matches this field.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.allow-multiple-entries
description: Set if multiple Entries are allowed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.authy.id
description: The identifier for the multifactor provider. In most cases, this need not be configured explicitly, unless multiple instances of the same provider type are configured in CAS.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.namespace
description: Defines the namespace of the application POD through the Service Discovery REST API of Kubernetes.

name: cas.authn.mongo.pool.min-size
description: Minimum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.authn.pm.forgot-username.mail.html
description: Indicate whether the message body should be evaluated as HTML text.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].query-attributes
description:
Define a {@code Map} of query attribute names to data-layer attribute names to use when building the query.
The key is always the name of the query attribute that is defined by CAS and passed internally,
and the value is the column/field that should map.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.pool.num-tests-per-eviction-run
description: Sets the maximum number of objects to examine during each run (if any) of the idle object evictor thread. When positive, the number of tests performed for a run will be the minimum of the configured value and the number of idle instances in the pool. When negative, the number of tests performed will be ceil(getNumIdle()/ abs(getNumTestsPerEvictionRun())) which means that when the value is -n roughly one nth of the idle objects will be tested per run.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.wan-replication.enabled
description: Whether WAN should be enabled.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.credential-secret-key
description: Use secret key provided by AWS to authenticate.

name: cas.authn.wsfed[].order
description: The order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.service-registry.jpa.pool.min-size
description: Controls the minimum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.spnego.properties[].timeout
description: Spnego JCIFS timeout.

name: cas.saml-sp.slack.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.rest.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.mongo.host
description: MongoDb database host for authentication. Multiple host addresses may be defined, separated by comma. If more than one host is defined, it is assumed that each host contains the port as well, if any. Otherwise the configuration may fallback onto the port defined.

name: cas.http-web-request.custom-headers
description: Custom response headers to inject into the response as needed.

name: cas.authn.pm.forgot-username.mail.text
description:
Email message body. Could be plain text or a reference to an external file that would serve as a template.

If specified as a path to an external file with an extension {@code .gtemplate}, then the email message body would be processed using the Groovy template engine. The template engine uses JSP style <% %> script and <%= %> expression syntax or GString style expressions. The variable {@code out} is bound to the writer that the template is being written to.

If using plain text, the contents are processed for string subtitution candidates using named variables. For example, you may refer to an expected url variable in the email text via {@code ${url}}, or use {@code ${token}} to locate the token variable. In certain cases, additional parameters are passed to the email body processor that might include authentication and/or principal attributes, the available locale, client http information, etc.

name: cas.warning-cookie.same-site-policy
description:
If a cookie is only intended to be accessed in a first party context, the developer has the option to apply one of settings {@code SameSite=Lax} or {@code SameSite=Strict} or {@code SameSite=None} to prevent external access.

To safeguard more websites and their users, the new secure-by-default model assumes all cookies should be protected from external access unless otherwise specified. Developers must use a new cookie setting, {@code SameSite=None}, to designate cookies for cross-site access. When the {@code SameSite=None} attribute is present, an additional {@code Secure} attribute is used so cross-site cookies can only be accessed over HTTPS connections.

Accepted values are:
  • {@code Lax}
  • {@code Strict}
  • {@code None}
  • {@code Off}: Disable the generation of the SameSite cookie attribute altogether.
  • Path to a Groovy script that is able to generate the SameSite cookie attribute dynamically.
  • Fully qualified name of a class that implements {@code org.apereo.cas.web.cookie.CookieSameSitePolicy}

name: cas.consent.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].merge-attribute.attribute-names
description: The Attribute names.

name: cas.authn.reject.password-encoder.hash-length
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2}, it indicates the hash strength/length.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.api-token
description: Defines an oauth token for the kubernetes client to access the kubernetes REST API. Defaults to reading the token from the auto-injected file at: {@code /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oauth2[].id
description: The client id.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.core.enable-compression
description: Enables compression when default java serialization is used.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.jpa.idle-timeout
description: Controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.pool.enabled
description: Enable the pooling configuration.

name: cas.monitor.ldap[].trust-manager
description:
Trust Manager options. Trust managers are responsible for managing the trust material that is used when making LDAP trust decisions, and for deciding whether credentials presented by a peer should be accepted. Accepted values are: *
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Enable and force the default JVM trust managers.
  • {@code ANY}: Trust any client or server.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.allow-unsigned-id-tokens
description: Whether unsigned id tokens issued as plain JWTs are accepted.

name: cas.authn.spnego.principal.use-existing-principal-id
description: Uses an existing principal id that may have already been established in order to run person directory queries. This is generally useful in situations where authentication is delegated to an external identity provider and a principal is first established to then query an attribute source.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.validator.search-filter
description: Search filter to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].logout-response-binding-type
description:
Control the logout response binding type during logout operations as invoked
by an external IdP and in response to logout requests.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.mongo.timeout
description: MongoDb database connection timeout.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.binary-attributes
description: Indicate the collection of attributes that are to be tagged and processed as binary attributes by the underlying search resolver.

name: cas.audit.redis.sentinel.master
description: Name of Redis server.

name: cas.audit.redis.cluster.nodes[].host
description: Server's host address.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.sentinel.node
description: list of host:port pairs.

name: cas.sms-provider.sns.endpoint
description: AWS custom endpoint.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.trust-store
description: Path to the keystore used to determine which certificates or certificate authorities should be trusted. Used when connecting to an LDAP server via LDAPS or startTLS connection. If left blank, the default truststore for the Java runtime is used.

name: cas.service-registry.mail.bcc
description: Email BCC address, if any.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.sasl-mutual-auth
description: SASL mutual auth is enabled?

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.port
description: Redis server port.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].queue-capacity
description:
For huge clusters or high data mutation rates, you might need to increase the replication queue size.
The default queue size for replication queues is 10,000. This means, if you have heavy put/update/remove
rates, you might exceed the queue size so that the oldest, not yet replicated, updates might get
lost.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].azure.principal-id-attribute
description:
The attribute found in the identity provider response
that may be used to establish the authenticated
user and build a profile for CAS.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.keystore-password
description: Keystore password.

name: cas.authn.reject.principal-transformation.suffix
description: Suffix to add to the principal id prior to authentication.

name: cas.authn.oauth.session-replication.cookie.auto-configure-cookie-path
description: Decide if cookie paths should be automatically configured based on the application context path, when the cookie path is not configured.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.service-label-name
description: Defines the service label to lookup through the Service Discovery REST API of Kubernetes.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.mail.subject
description:
Email subject line.

The subject can either be defined verbaitm, or it may point to a message key in the language bundle using the syntax {@code #{subject-language-key}}. This key should point to a valid message defined in the appropriate language bundle that is then picked up via the active locale. In case where the language code cannot resolve the real subject, a default subject value would be used.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].fail-fast
description:
Attempt to populate the connection pool early on startup
and fail quickly if something goes wrong.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.pool.max-size
description: Controls the maximum number of connections to keep in the pool, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.read-only
description: Configures the Connections to be added to the pool as read-only Connections.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.grouper.id
description: A value can be assigned to this field to uniquely identify this resolver.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].merge-attribute.merge-attribute-name
description: The Merge attribute name.

name: cas.authn.adaptive.policy.reject-countries
description: Comma-separated list of strings representing countries to be rejected from participating in authentication transactions.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.validator.scope
description: Search scope to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.jaas[].password-policy.display-warning-on-match
description:
Indicates if warning should be displayed, when the ldap attribute value
matches the {@link #warningAttributeValue}.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].queue-full-behavior
description:
Accepted values are:
  • {@code THROW_EXCEPTION}: Instruct WAN replication implementation to throw an exception and doesn't allow further processing.
  • {@code DISCARD_AFTER_MUTATION}: Instruct WAN replication implementation to drop new events when WAN event queues are full.
  • {@code THROW_EXCEPTION_ONLY_IF_REPLICATION_ACTIVE}: Similar to {@code THROW_EXCEPTION} but only throws exception when WAN replication is active. * Discards the new events if WAN replication is stopped.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.bypass.authentication-handler-name
description: Skip multifactor authentication depending on form of primary authentication execution. Specifically, skip multifactor if the a particular authentication handler noted by its name successfully is able to authenticate credentials in the primary factor.

name: cas.authn.jaas[].password-encoder.character-encoding
description:
The encoding algorithm to use such as 'UTF-8'.
Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT}.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].password-policy.groovy.location
description:
Handle password policy via Groovy script. The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.wsfed[].identity-provider-identifier
description: The entity id or the identifier of the Wsfed instance.

name: cas.events.core.track-configuration-modifications
description: Whether CAS should track the underlying configuration store for changes. This depends on whether the store provides that sort of functionality. When running in standalone mode, this typically translates to CAS monitoring configuration files and reloading context conditionally if there are any changes.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].physical-naming-strategy-class-name
description: Fully-qualified name of the class that can control the physical naming strategy of hibernate.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.ldap-authz.role-prefix
description: Prefix for the role.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].properties
description: Additional settings provided by Hibernate (or the connection provider) in form of key-value pairs.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.health-query
description: The SQL query to be executed to test the validity of connections. This is for "legacy" databases that do not support the JDBC4 {@code Connection.isValid()} API.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.recursive.merge-attributes
description: The Merge attributes.

name: cas.saml-sp.benefit-focus.description
description: Description of this service provider as it's stored in the registry.

name: cas.ticket.st.time-to-kill-in-seconds
description: Time in seconds that service tickets should be considered live in CAS server.

name: cas.monitor.mongo[].pool.idle-time
description:
The maximum idle time of a pooled connection.  A zero value indicates no limit
to the idle time.  A pooled connection that has
exceeded its idle time will be closed and replaced when necessary by a new connection.

name: cas.authn.syncope.order
description: The order of this authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.service-registry.mongo.pool.max-size
description: Maximum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.saml-sp.arc-g-i-s.name-id-attribute
description: Attribute to use when generating nameids for this SP.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.dynamo-db.profile-path
description: Profile path.

name: cas.authn.azure-active-directory.password-encoder.strength
description: Strength or number of iterations to use for password hashing. Usually relevant when dealing with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT}. When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the salt strength.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.bind-credential
description: The bind credential to use when connecting to LDAP.

name: cas.saml-sp.gartner.description
description: Description of this service provider as it's stored in the registry.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.id
description: The client id.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mail.from
description: Email from address.

name: cas.consent.redis.sentinel.master
description: Name of Redis server.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.azure.tenant-id
description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].order
description:
The order of this attribute repository in the chain of repositories.
Can be used to explicitly position this source in chain and affects
merging strategies.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.pool.min-size
description: Controls the minimum size that the pool is allowed to reach, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.spnego.alternative-remote-host-attribute
description: Alternative header name to use in order to find the host address.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.read-only
description: Configures the Connections to be added to the pool as read-only Connections.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.primary-group-id.group-filter
description: The Group filter.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.mongo.client-uri
description: The connection uri to the mongodb instance. This typically takes on the form of {@code mongodb://user:psw@ds135522.somewhere.com:35522/db}. If not specified, will fallback onto other individual settings. If specified, takes over all other settings where applicable.

name: cas.sms-provider.sms-mode.access-token
description: Secure token used to establish a handshake with the service.

name: cas.authn.cognito.password-encoder.encoding-algorithm

description:
Sets the maximum time in seconds that this data source will wait while attempting to connect to a database.

A value of zero specifies that the timeout is the default system timeout if there is one; otherwise, it specifies that there is no timeout.

This property controls the keepalive interval for a connection in the pool. An in-use connection

name: cas.webflow.session.server.max-conversations
description: Using the maxConversations property, you can limit the number of concurrently active conversations allowed in a single session. If the maximum is exceeded, the conversation manager will automatically end the oldest conversation. The default is 5, which should be fine for most situations. Set it to -1 for no limit. Setting maxConversations to 1 allows easy resource cleanup in situations where there should only be one active conversation per session. Only relevant if session storage is done on the server.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.type
description:
The type of search entry handler to choose. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_REFERRAL}: Provides handling of an ldap referral for search operations.
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_RESULT_REFERENCE}: Provides handling of an ldap continuation reference for search operations.
  • {@code ACTIVE_DIRECTORY}: Process the entry results fetched from active directory and check for account status controls for disabled/expired accounts, etc.
  • {@code OBJECT_GUID}: Object guid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectGUID} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code OBJECT_SID}: Object sid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectSid} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code CASE_CHANGE}: Case change search entry handler. Provides the ability to modify the case of search entry DNs, attribute names, and attribute values.
  • {@code DN_ATTRIBUTE_ENTRY}: DN attribute entry handler. Adds the entry DN as an attribute to the result set. Provides a client side implementation of RFC 5020.
  • {@code MERGE}: Merge search entry handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes into a single attribute.
  • {@code PRIMARY_GROUP}: Primary group search handler. Constructs the primary group SID and then searches for that group and puts it's DN in the {@code memberOf} attribute of the original search entry.
  • {@code RANGE_ENTRY}: Range entry search handler. Rewrites attributes returned from Active Directory to include all values by performing additional searches.
  • {@code RECURSIVE_ENTRY}: Recursive entry search handler. This recursively searches based on a supplied attribute and merges those results into the original entry.
  • {@code MERGE_ENTRIES}: Merge entries handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes in all entries into a single attribute. The merged attribute may or may not already exist on the entry. If it does exist it's existing values will remain intact.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].display-name

If left blank, the client original name would be used by default.

name: cas.ticket.registry.cosmos-db.allow-telemetry

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.base-dn
description: Base DN to use. There may be scenarios where different parts of a single LDAP tree could be considered as base-dns. Rather than duplicating the LDAP configuration block for each individual base-dn, each entry can be specified and joined together using a special delimiter character. The user DN is retrieved using the combination of all base-dn and DN resolvers in the order defined. DN resolution should fail if multiple DNs are found. Otherwise the first DN found is returned. Usual syntax is: {@code subtreeA,dc=example,dc=net|subtreeC,dc=example,dc=net}.

name: cas.authn.pm.forgot-username.mail.cc

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mongo.replica-set
description: A replica set in MongoDB is a group of {@code mongod} processes that maintain the same data set. Replica sets provide redundancy and high availability, and are the basis for all production deployments.

name: cas.monitor.ldap[].response-timeout
description: Duration of time to wait for responses.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.share-native-connections
description: The shared native connection is never closed by Lettuce connection, therefore it is not validated by default when connections are retrieved. If this setting is {@code true}, a shared connection will be used for regular operations and a connection provider will be used to select a connection for blocking and tx operations only, which should not share a connection. If native connection sharing is disabled, new (or pooled) connections will be used for all operations. By default, multiple connections share a single thread-safe native connection. If you enable connection pooling, then native connection sharing will be disabled and the connection pool will be used for all operations. You may however explicitly control connection sharing via this setting as an override.

A positive value indicates that the cookie will expire after that many seconds have passed. Note that the value is the maximum age when the cookie will expire, not the cookie's current age. A negative value means that the cookie is not stored persistently and will be deleted when the Web browser exits. A zero value causes the cookie to be deleted.

description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.pool-passivator
description:
You may receive unexpected LDAP failures, when CAS is configured to authenticate using {@code DIRECT} or {@code AUTHENTICATED} types and LDAP is locked down to not allow anonymous binds/searches. Every second attempt with a given LDAP connection from the pool would fail if it was on the same connection as a failed login attempt, and the regular connection validator would similarly fail. When a connection is returned back to a pool, it still may contain the principal and credentials from the previous attempt. Before the next bind attempt using that connection, the validator tries to validate the connection again but fails because it’s no longer trying with the configured bind credentials but with whatever user DN was used in the previous step. Given the validation failure, the connection is closed and CAS would deny access by default. Passivators attempt to reconnect to LDAP with the configured bind credentials, effectively resetting the connection to what it should be after each bind request. Furthermore if you are seeing errors in the logs that resemble a 'Operation exception encountered, reopening connection' type of message, this usually is an indication that the connection pool’s validation timeout established and created by CAS is greater than the timeout configured in the LDAP server, or more likely, in the load balancer in front of the LDAP servers. You can adjust the LDAP server session’s timeout for connections, or you can teach CAS to use a validity period that is equal or less than the LDAP server session’s timeout. Accepted values are:
  • {@code NONE}: No passivation takes place.
  • {@code BIND}: The default behavior which passivates a connection by performing a bind operation on it. This option requires the availability of bind credentials when establishing connections to LDAP.

name: cas.server.tomcat.socket.performance-connection-time
description: An int expressing the relative importance of a short connection time. Performance preferences are described by three integers whose values indicate the relative importance of short connection time, low latency, and high bandwidth. The absolute values of the integers are irrelevant; in order to choose a protocol the values are  compared, with larger values indicating stronger preferences. Negative values disable the setting. If the application prefers short connection time over both low latency and high bandwidth, for example, then it could invoke this method with the values (1, 0, 0). If the application prefers high bandwidth above low latency, and low latency above short connection time, then it could invoke this method with the values (0, 1, 2).

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].ddl-auto
description:
Hibernate feature to automatically validate and exports DDL to the schema. By default, creates and drops the schema automatically when a session is starts and ends. Setting the value to {@code validate} or {@code none} may be more desirable for production, but any of the following options can be used:
  • {@code validate}: Validate the schema, but make no changes to the database.
  • {@code update}: Update the schema.
  • {@code create}: Create the schema, destroying previous data.
  • {@code create-drop}: Drop the schema at the end of the session.
  • {@code none}: Do nothing.

Note that during a version migration where any schema has changed {@code create-drop} will result in the loss of all data as soon as CAS is started. For transient data like tickets this is probably not an issue, but in cases like the audit table important data could be lost. Using `update`, while safe for data, is confirmed to result in invalid database state. {@code validate} or {@code none} settings are likely the only safe options for production use.

For more info, see this.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.cluster.nodes[].replica-of
description: Set the id of the master node.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].disable-pooling
description: Whether to use a pooled connection factory in components.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].state
description:
Define the scope and state of this authentication handler
and the lifecycle in which it can be invoked or activated.

name: cas.authn.oauth.access-token.time-to-kill-in-seconds
description: Sliding window for the access token expiration policy. Essentially, this is an idle time out.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.trust-certificates

number of connections that can be created
