name: cas.authn.wsfed[].cookie.name
description:
Cookie name. Constructs a cookie with a specified name and value.
The name must conform to RFC 2965. That means it can contain only ASCII alphanumeric characters and
cannot contain commas, semicolons, or white space or begin with a {@code $} character.
The cookie's name cannot be changed after creation.
By default, cookies are created according to the RFC 2965 cookie specification.
Cookie names are automatically calculated assigned by CAS at runtime, and there is usually
no need to customize the name or assign it a different value unless a special use case warrants the change.

name: cas.saml-sp.bynder.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.mongo.timeout
description: MongoDb database connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.subtree-search
description: Whether subtree searching is allowed.

name: cas.consent.redis.read-from
description:
Setting that describes how Lettuce routes read operations to replica nodes. Note that modes referencing MASTER/SLAVE are deprecated (but still supported) in the Lettuce redis client dependency so migrate config to UPSTREAM/REPLICA. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code UPSTREAM}: Read from the current upstream node.
  • {@code UPSTREAMPREFERRED}: Read from the upstream node, but if it is unavailable, read from replica nodes.
  • {@code MASTER}: Read from the current upstream node.
  • {@code MASTERPREFERRED}: Read from the upstream node, but if it is unavailable, read from replica nodes.
  • {@code SLAVE}: Read from replica nodes.
  • {@code SLAVEPREFERRED}: Read from the replica nodes, but if none is unavailable, read from the upstream node.
  • {@code REPLICA}: Read from replica nodes.
  • {@code REPLICAPREFERRED}: Read from the replica nodes, but if none is unavailable, read from the upstream node.
  • {@code ANY}: Read from any node of the cluster.
  • {@code ANYREPLICA}: Read from any replica node of the cluster.
  • {@code NEAREST}: Read from the nearest node.

name: cas.standalone.configuration-security.initialization-vector
description: An initialization vector is required for {@code PBEWithDigestAndAES} algorithms that aren't BouncyCastle. Enabling an initialization vector will break passwords encrypted without one. Toggling this value will make pre-existing non-{@code PBEWithDigestAndAES} encrypted passwords not work. For non-BouncyCastle {@code PBEWithDigestAndAES} algorithms that require an initialization vector, one will be used regardless of this setting since backwards compatibility with existing passwords using those algorithms is not an issue (since they didn't work in previous CAS versions). The default value is false so as not to break existing encrypted passwords. In general the use of an initialization vector will increase the encrypted text's length.

name: cas.saml-sp.gartner.name-id-attribute
description: Attribute to use when generating nameids for this SP.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.jdbc.fetch-size
description: Used to specify number of rows to be fetched in a select query.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].search-referral.limit
description: The default referral limit.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.simple.pool-passivator
description:
You may receive unexpected LDAP failures, when CAS is configured to authenticate using {@code DIRECT} or {@code AUTHENTICATED} types and LDAP is locked down to not allow anonymous binds/searches. Every second attempt with a given LDAP connection from the pool would fail if it was on the same connection as a failed login attempt, and the regular connection validator would similarly fail. When a connection is returned back to a pool, it still may contain the principal and credentials from the previous attempt. Before the next bind attempt using that connection, the validator tries to validate the connection again but fails because it’s no longer trying with the configured bind credentials but with whatever user DN was used in the previous step. Given the validation failure, the connection is closed and CAS would deny access by default. Passivators attempt to reconnect to LDAP with the configured bind credentials, effectively resetting the connection to what it should be after each bind request. Furthermore if you are seeing errors in the logs that resemble a 'Operation exception encountered, reopening connection' type of message, this usually is an indication that the connection pool’s validation timeout established and created by CAS is greater than the timeout configured in the LDAP server, or more likely, in the load balancer in front of the LDAP servers. You can adjust the LDAP server session’s timeout for connections, or you can teach CAS to use a validity period that is equal or less than the LDAP server session’s timeout. Accepted values are:
  • {@code NONE}: No passivation takes place.
  • {@code BIND}: The default behavior which passivates a connection by performing a bind operation on it. This option requires the availability of bind credentials when establishing connections to LDAP.

name: cas.saml-sp.poll-everywhere.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.network.ssl.validate-identity
description: Flag which allows enabling endpoint identity validation. It means, during the TLS handshake client verifies if the server’s hostname (or IP address) matches the information in X.509 certificate (Subject Alternative Name extension).

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.grouper.state
description:
Whether attribute resolution based on this source is enabled. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code ACTIVE}: Active and enabled repository, and is invoked by default automatically.
  • {@code DISABLED}: Attribute repository is disabled and will not be used to resolve people and attributes.
  • {@code STANDBY}: Repository is in a semi-enabled state, waiting to be called only on-demand when explicitly asked for and will not be registered into the resolution plan.

name: cas.audit.jdbc.pool.suspension

Whether or not pool suspension is allowed.

There is a performance impact when pool suspension is enabled. Unless you need it (for a redundancy system for example) do not enable it.

If multiple URLs are provided as the ldapURL this describes how each URL will be processed.
  • {@code ACTIVE_PASSIVE} First LDAP will be used for every request unless it fails and then the next shall be used.
  • {@code ROUND_ROBIN} For each new connection the next url in the list will be used.
  • {@code RANDOM} For each new connection a random LDAP url will be selected.
  • {@code DNS_SRV} LDAP urls based on DNS SRV records of the configured/given LDAP url will be used.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.password-encoder.type
description:
Define the password encoder type to use. Type may be specified as blank or {@code NONE} to disable password encoding. It may also refer to a fully-qualified class name that implements the Spring Security's {@code PasswordEncoder} interface if you wish you define your own encoder.

The following types may be used:

  • {@code NONE}: No password encoding (i.e. plain-text) takes place.
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Use the {@code DefaultPasswordEncoder} of CAS. For message-digest algorithms via {@code character-encoding} and {@code encoding-algorithm}.
  • {@code BCRYPT}: Use the {@code BCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code SCRYPT}: Use the {@code SCryptPasswordEncoder}.
  • {@code PBKDF2}: Use the {@code Pbkdf2PasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code STANDARD}: Use the {@code StandardPasswordEncoder} based on the secret provided.
  • {@code SSHA}: Use the {@code LdapShaPasswordEncoder} supports Ldap SHA and SSHA (salted-SHA). The values are base-64 encoded and have the label {SHA} or {SSHA} prepended to the encoded hash.
  • {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}: Use the {@code GlibcCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the {@code encoding-algorithm}, strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code org.example.MyEncoder}: An implementation of {@code PasswordEncoder} of your own choosing.
  • {@code file:///path/to/script.groovy}: Path to a Groovy script charged with handling password encoding operations.

The maximum age of the cookie, specified in seconds. By default, {@code -1} indicating

A positive value indicates that the cookie will expire after that many seconds have passed. Note that the value is

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.core.replicated
description:
A Replicated Map is a distributed key-value data structure where the data is replicated to all members in the cluster. It provides full replication of entries to all members for high speed access. A Replicated Map does not partition data (it does not spread data to different cluster members); instead, it replicates the data to all members. Replication leads to higher memory consumption. However, a Replicated Map has faster read and write access since the data is available on all members. Writes could take place on local/remote members in order to provide write-order, eventually being replicated to all other members.

If you have a large cluster or very high occurrences of updates, the Replicated Map may not scale linearly as expected since it has to replicate update operations to all members in the cluster. Since the replication of updates is performed in an asynchronous manner, Hazelcast recommends you enable back pressure in case your system has high occurrences of updates.

Note that Replicated Map does not guarantee eventual consistency because there are some edge cases that fail to provide consistency.

Replicated Map uses the internal partition system of Hazelcast in order to serialize updates happening on the same key at the same time. This happens by sending updates of the same key to the same Hazelcast member in the cluster.

Due to the asynchronous nature of replication, a Hazelcast member could die before successfully replicating a "write" operation to other members after sending the "write completed" response to its caller during the write process. In this scenario, Hazelcast’s internal partition system promotes one of the replicas of the partition as the primary one. The new primary partition does not have the latest "write" since the dead member could not successfully replicate the update.

A regular expression pattern that indicates the set of allowed IP addresses,

the cookie can still be considered valid if the new IP address matches the pattern
specified here.

description: Enable the pooling configuration.

name: cas.authn.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].connection-strategy
description:
If multiple URLs are provided as the ldapURL this describes how each URL will be processed.
  • {@code ACTIVE_PASSIVE} First LDAP will be used for every request unless it fails and then the next shall be used.
  • {@code ROUND_ROBIN} For each new connection the next url in the list will be used.
  • {@code RANDOM} For each new connection a random LDAP url will be selected.
  • {@code DNS_SRV} LDAP urls based on DNS SRV records of the configured/given LDAP url will be used.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.cluster.username
description: The cluster connection's username.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.sasl-security-strength
description: SASL security strength.

name: cas.audit.engine.alternate-client-addr-header-name
description:
Request header to use to identify the client address.

If the application is sitting behind a load balancer, the client address typically ends up being the load balancer address itself. A common example for a header here would be {@code X-Forwarded-For} to glean the client address from the request, assuming the load balancer is configured correctly to pass that header along.

name: cas.clearpass.cache-credential
description: Enable clearpass and allow CAS to cache credentials.

name: cas.authn.x509.principal-type
description:
Indicates the type of principal resolution for X509. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code CN_EDIPI}: Create principal by common name and EDIPI.
  • {@code RFC822_EMAIL}: Create principal from the RFC822 type name (aka email address) in the subject alternative name field. The subject alternative name field contains a list of various types of names, one type is RFC822 e-mail address. This will return the first e-mail address that is found (if there are more than one).
  • {@code SERIAL_NO}: Create principal by serial no. Resolve the principal by the serial number with a configurable radix, ranging from 2 to 36. If {@code radix} is {@code 16}, then the serial number could be filled with leading zeros to even the number of digits.
  • {@code SERIAL_NO_DN}: Create principal by serial no and DN.
  • {@code SUBJECT}: Create principal by subject. Resolve the principal by extracting one or more attribute values from the certificate subject DN and combining them with intervening delimiters.
  • {@code SUBJECT_ALT_NAME}: Create principal by subject alternative name. Resolve the principal by the subject alternative name extension. (type: otherName).
  • {@code SUBJECT_DN}: Create principal by subject DN.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.sql-unlock-account
description: SQL query to unlock accounts.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.mongo.pool.max-size
description: Maximum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.primary-group-id.group-filter
description: The Group filter.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.ddl-auto
description:
Hibernate feature to automatically validate and exports DDL to the schema. By default, creates and drops the schema automatically when a session is starts and ends. Setting the value to {@code validate} or {@code none} may be more desirable for production, but any of the following options can be used:
  • {@code validate}: Validate the schema, but make no changes to the database.
  • {@code update}: Update the schema.
  • {@code create}: Create the schema, destroying previous data.
  • {@code create-drop}: Drop the schema at the end of the session.
  • {@code none}: Do nothing.

Note that during a version migration where any schema has changed {@code create-drop} will result in the loss of all data as soon as CAS is started. For transient data like tickets this is probably not an issue, but in cases like the audit table important data could be lost. Using `update`, while safe for data, is confirmed to result in invalid database state. {@code validate} or {@code none} settings are likely the only safe options for production use.

For more info, see this.

name: cas.logout.remove-descendant-tickets
description: Indicates whether tickets issued and linked to a ticket-granting ticket should also be removed as part of logout. There are a number of tickets issued by CAS whose expiration policy is usually by default bound to the SSO expiration policy and the active TGT, yet such tickets may be allowed to live beyond the normal lifetime of a CAS SSO session with options to be renewed. Examples include OAuth's access tokens, etc. Set this option to true if you want all linked tickets to be removed.

name: cas.saml-sp.tableau.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.cookie.secure

name: cas.authn.x509.ldap.trust-store-password

name: cas.ticket.registry.mongo.update-indexes

name: cas.authn.rest[].password-encoder.strength
description:
Strength or number of iterations to use for password hashing.
Usually relevant when dealing with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT}.
When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the salt strength.

description: Configures the Connections to be added to the pool as read-only Connections.

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.enabled
description: Whether managing tickets via JPA is enabled.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.bind[].password-encoder.type
description:
Define the password encoder type to use. Type may be specified as blank or {@code NONE} to disable password encoding. It may also refer to a fully-qualified class name that implements the Spring Security's {@code PasswordEncoder} interface if you wish you define your own encoder.

The following types may be used:

  • {@code NONE}: No password encoding (i.e. plain-text) takes place.
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Use the {@code DefaultPasswordEncoder} of CAS. For message-digest algorithms via {@code character-encoding} and {@code encoding-algorithm}.
  • {@code BCRYPT}: Use the {@code BCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code SCRYPT}: Use the {@code SCryptPasswordEncoder}.
  • {@code PBKDF2}: Use the {@code Pbkdf2PasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code STANDARD}: Use the {@code StandardPasswordEncoder} based on the secret provided.
  • {@code SSHA}: Use the {@code LdapShaPasswordEncoder} supports Ldap SHA and SSHA (salted-SHA). The values are base-64 encoded and have the label {SHA} or {SSHA} prepended to the encoded hash.
  • {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}: Use the {@code GlibcCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the {@code encoding-algorithm}, strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code org.example.MyEncoder}: An implementation of {@code PasswordEncoder} of your own choosing.
  • {@code file:///path/to/script.groovy}: Path to a Groovy script charged with handling password encoding operations.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.service-label-name
description: Defines the service label to lookup through the Service Discovery REST API of Kubernetes.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.ldap.bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].disable-pooling
description: Whether to use a pooled connection factory in components.

name: cas.consent.jpa.fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.jpa.pool.name
description: Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.network.members
description: Sets the well known members. If members is empty, calling this method will have the same effect as calling {@code clear()}. A member can be a comma separated string, e..g {@code 10.11.12.1,10.11.12.2} which indicates multiple members are going to be added. The list of members must include ALL CAS server node, including the current node that owns this configuration.

name: cas.ticket.registry.mongo.pool.min-size
description: Minimum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.google-analytics.cookie.http-only
description: true if this cookie contains the HttpOnly attribute. This means that the cookie should not be accessible to scripting engines, like javascript.

name: cas.authn.radius.password-encoder.type
description:
Define the password encoder type to use. Type may be specified as blank or {@code NONE} to disable password encoding. It may also refer to a fully-qualified class name that implements the Spring Security's {@code PasswordEncoder} interface if you wish you define your own encoder.

The following types may be used:

  • {@code NONE}: No password encoding (i.e. plain-text) takes place.
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Use the {@code DefaultPasswordEncoder} of CAS. For message-digest algorithms via {@code character-encoding} and {@code encoding-algorithm}.
  • {@code BCRYPT}: Use the {@code BCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code SCRYPT}: Use the {@code SCryptPasswordEncoder}.
  • {@code PBKDF2}: Use the {@code Pbkdf2PasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code STANDARD}: Use the {@code StandardPasswordEncoder} based on the secret provided.
  • {@code SSHA}: Use the {@code LdapShaPasswordEncoder} supports Ldap SHA and SSHA (salted-SHA). The values are base-64 encoded and have the label {SHA} or {SSHA} prepended to the encoded hash.
  • {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}: Use the {@code GlibcCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the {@code encoding-algorithm}, strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code org.example.MyEncoder}: An implementation of {@code PasswordEncoder} of your own choosing.
  • {@code file:///path/to/script.groovy}: Path to a Groovy script charged with handling password encoding operations.

name: cas.sso.services.required-service-pattern
description: A regular expression pattern that represents an application which must have established a session with CAS already before access to other applications can be allowed by CAS. This is the initial mandatory/required application with which the user must start before going anywhere else. Services that establish a session with CAS typically do so by receiving a service ticket from CAS.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].disable-pooling
description: Whether to use a pooled connection factory in components.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.git.clear-existing-identities
description: When establishing an ssh session, determine if default identities loaded on the machine should be excluded/removed and identity should only be limited to those loaded from given keys.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.jpa.batch-size
description: A non-zero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. e.g. recommended values between 5 and 30.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mail.priority
description: Set the priority ({@code X-Priority} header) of the message. Values: {@code 1 (Highest)}, {@code 2 (High)}, {@code 3 (Normal)}, {@code 4 (Low)}, {@code 5 (Lowest)}.

name: cas.ticket.registry.redis.enabled
description: Whether the module is enabled or not, defaults to true.

name: cas.authn.mfa.triggers.rest.basic-auth-password
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the password for authentication.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.jpa.default-catalog
description: Qualifies unqualified table names with the given catalog in generated SQL.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.device-fingerprint.cookie.enabled
description: Is this component enabled or not.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.ticket.registry.redis.share-native-connections
description: The shared native connection is never closed by Lettuce connection, therefore it is not validated by default when connections are retrieved. If this setting is {@code true}, a shared connection will be used for regular operations and a connection provider will be used to select a connection for blocking and tx operations only, which should not share a connection. If native connection sharing is disabled, new (or pooled) connections will be used for all operations. By default, multiple connections share a single thread-safe native connection. If you enable connection pooling, then native connection sharing will be disabled and the connection pool will be used for all operations. You may however explicitly control connection sharing via this setting as an override.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].metadata.service-provider.jdbc.idle-timeout
description: Controls the maximum amount of time that a connection is allowed to sit idle in the pool.

name: cas.authn.redis.pool.max-idle
description: Max number of "idle" connections in the pool. Use a negative value to indicate an unlimited number of idle connections.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.jdbc.password-encoder.type
description:
Define the password encoder type to use. Type may be specified as blank or {@code NONE} to disable password encoding. It may also refer to a fully-qualified class name that implements the Spring Security's {@code PasswordEncoder} interface if you wish you define your own encoder.

The following types may be used:

  • {@code NONE}: No password encoding (i.e. plain-text) takes place.
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Use the {@code DefaultPasswordEncoder} of CAS. For message-digest algorithms via {@code character-encoding} and {@code encoding-algorithm}.
  • {@code BCRYPT}: Use the {@code BCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code SCRYPT}: Use the {@code SCryptPasswordEncoder}.
  • {@code PBKDF2}: Use the {@code Pbkdf2PasswordEncoder} based on the strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code STANDARD}: Use the {@code StandardPasswordEncoder} based on the secret provided.
  • {@code SSHA}: Use the {@code LdapShaPasswordEncoder} supports Ldap SHA and SSHA (salted-SHA). The values are base-64 encoded and have the label {SHA} or {SSHA} prepended to the encoded hash.
  • {@code GLIBC_CRYPT}: Use the {@code GlibcCryptPasswordEncoder} based on the {@code encoding-algorithm}, strength provided and an optional secret.
  • {@code org.example.MyEncoder}: An implementation of {@code PasswordEncoder} of your own choosing.
  • {@code file:///path/to/script.groovy}: Path to a Groovy script charged with handling password encoding operations.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.dynamo-db.billing-mode
description:
Billing mode specifies how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PROVISIONED}: Provisioned mode means that you specify the number of reads and writes per second that you expect your application to use. Provisioned mode is a good option if any of the following are true:
    • You have predictable application traffic.
    • You run applications whose traffic is consistent or ramps gradually.
    • You can forecast capacity requirements to control costs.
    You can use auto scaling to automatically adjust capacity based on the specified utilization rate to ensure application performance while reducing costs.
  • {@code PAY_PER_REQUEST}: Pay-per-request or on-demand billing means that you're charged for only the read/write requests that you use. On-demand mode is a good option if any of the following are true:
    • You create new tables with unknown workloads.
    • You have unpredictable application traffic.
    • You prefer the ease of paying for only what you use.
    Tables using on-demand mode support all DynamoDB features (such as encryption at rest, point-in-time recovery, global tables, and so on) with the exception of auto scaling, which is not applicable with this mode.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.dynamo-db.endpoint
description: AWS custom endpoint.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.jpa.physical-naming-strategy-class-name
description: Fully-qualified name of the class that can control the physical naming strategy of hibernate.

name: cas.saml-sp.webex.metadata

name: cas.consent.jpa.health-query

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.order
description: The order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.monitor.ldap[].connection-strategy
description:
If multiple URLs are provided as the ldapURL this describes how each URL will be processed.
  • {@code ACTIVE_PASSIVE} First LDAP will be used for every request unless it fails and then the next shall be used.
  • {@code ROUND_ROBIN} For each new connection the next url in the list will be used.
  • {@code RANDOM} For each new connection a random LDAP url will be selected.
  • {@code DNS_SRV} LDAP urls based on DNS SRV records of the configured/given LDAP url will be used.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.core.timeout
description: Connection timeout in seconds for the TCP/IP config and members joining the cluster.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.amazon-s3.crypto.encryption.key-size
description: The encryption key size.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.s3.client-execution-timeout
description: Client execution timeout.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].password-policy.strategy
description:
Decide how authentication should handle password policy changes. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Default option to handle policy changes.
  • {@code GROOVY}: Handle account password policies via Groovy.
  • {@code REJECT_RESULT_CODE}: Strategy to only activate password policy if the authentication response code is not blocked.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.s3.connection-timeout
description: Connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.pool.keep-alive-time
description: This property controls the keepalive interval for a connection in the pool. An in-use connection will never be tested by the keepalive thread, only when it is idle will it be tested. Default is zero, which disables this feature.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.query[].url
description: The database connection URL.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.core.session-replication.cookie.auto-configure-cookie-path
description: Decide if cookie paths should be automatically configured based on the application context path, when the cookie path is not configured.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.hi-org-server.principal-id-attribute
description: The attribute found in the identity provider response that may be used to establish the authenticated user and build a profile for CAS.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.keystore
description: Path to the keystore used for SSL connections. Typically contains SSL certificates for the LDAP server.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.jpa.leak-threshold
description: Controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.token.bypass.rest.url
description: The endpoint URL to contact and retrieve attributes.

name: cas.authn.mongo.principal-transformation.prefix
description: Prefix to add to the principal id prior to authentication.

name: cas.authn.wsfed[].principal.active-attribute-repository-ids
description:
Activated attribute repository identifiers
that should be used for fetching attributes
if attribute resolution is enabled.
The list here may include identifiers separated by comma.

name: cas.authn.mfa.authy.order
description: The order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].search-result.limit
description: The default referral limit.

name: cas.authn.adaptive.risk.response.mfa-provider
description: If an authentication attempt is deemed risky, force a multi-factor authentication event noted by the provider id here.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.pool.test-on-create
description: Returns whether objects created for the pool will be validated before being returned from the borrowObject() method. Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, then borrowObject() will fail.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.primary-group-id.group-filter
description: The Group filter.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].case-canonicalization
description:
When constructing the final person object from the attribute repository, indicate how the username should be canonicalized. Accepted values are:
  • {@code UPPER}: Transform the final person id into uppercase characters.
  • {@code LOWER}: Transform the final person id into lowercase characters.
  • {@code NONE}: Do nothing.

name: cas.authn.spnego.webflow.order
description: The order in which the webflow is configured.

name: cas.tgc.domain
description: Cookie domain. Specifies the domain within which this cookie should be presented. The form of the domain name is specified by RFC 2965. A domain name begins with a dot (.foo.com) and means that the cookie is visible to servers in a specified Domain Name System (DNS) zone (for example, www.foo.com, but not a.b.foo.com). By default, cookies are only returned to the server that sent them.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.merge-attribute.merge-attribute-name
description: The Merge attribute name.

name: cas.view.rest.headers
description: Headers, defined as a Map, to include in the request when making the REST call. Will overwrite any header that CAS is pre-defined to send and include in the request. Key in the map should be the header name and the value in the map should be the header value.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.sql-change-password
description: SQL query to change the password and update.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.trust-store-type
description: The type of trust keystore that determines which certificates or certificate authorities are trusted. Types depend on underlying java platform, typically {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.authn.oauth.uma.resource-set.jpa.pool.max-wait
description:
Sets the maximum time in seconds that this data source will wait while attempting to connect to a database.

A value of zero specifies that the timeout is the default system timeout if there is one; otherwise, it specifies that there is no timeout.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.device-fingerprint.cookie.http-only
description: true if this cookie contains the HttpOnly attribute. This means that the cookie should not be accessible to scripting engines, like javascript.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.batch-size
description: A non-zero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. e.g. recommended values between 5 and 30.

name: cas.service-registry.jpa.fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

name: cas.monitor.memcached.failure-mode
description: Failure mode. Acceptable values are {@code Redistribute,Retry,Cancel}.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.ldap.validator.attribute-name
description: Attribute name to use for the compare validator.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].properties
description: Additional settings provided by Hibernate (or the connection provider) in form of key-value pairs.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].apple.callback-url
description:
Callback URL to use to return the flow
back to the CAS server one the identity
provider is successfully done. This may be
used at the discretion of the client and its type
to build service parameters, redirect URIs, etc.
If none is specified, the CAS server's login endpoint
will be used as the basis of the final callback url.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].password-encoder.hash-length
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2}, it indicates the hash strength/length.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.audit.redis.cluster.password
description: The cluster connection's password.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.dynamo-db.endpoint
description: AWS custom endpoint.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].password-encoder.character-encoding
description:
The encoding algorithm to use such as 'UTF-8'.
Relevant when the type used is {@code DEFAULT}.

name: cas.sms-provider.sms-mode.proxy-url
description: URL of the proxy (if defined).

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.cluster.nodes[].name
description: Name of this node.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.mongo.host
description: MongoDb database host for authentication. Multiple host addresses may be defined, separated by comma. If more than one host is defined, it is assumed that each host contains the port as well, if any. Otherwise the configuration may fallback onto the port defined.

name: cas.server.tomcat.http[].protocol
description: HTTP protocol to use.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].case-change.attribute-names
description: The Attribute names.

name: cas.account-registration.provisioning.rest.basic-auth-username
description: If REST endpoint is protected via basic authentication, specify the username for authentication.

name: cas.server.tomcat.http-proxy.secure
description: Whether proxy should run in secure mode.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.redis.pool.test-on-borrow
description: Returns whether objects borrowed from the pool will be validated before being returned from the borrowObject() method. Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be removed from the pool and destroyed, and a new attempt will be made to borrow an object from the pool.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.username
description: Login username of the redis server.

name: cas.saml-sp.arms-software.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mongo.retry-writes
description: Sets whether writes should be retried if they fail due to a network error.

name: cas.saml-sp.box.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].url
description: The database connection URL.

name: cas.monitor.st.warn.threshold
description: The monitor threshold where if reached, CAS might generate a warning status for health checks.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.search-entry-handlers
description: Search handlers.

name: cas.ticket.registry.mongo.write-concern
description: Write concern describes the level of acknowledgement requested from MongoDB for write operations to a standalone mongo db or to replica sets or to sharded clusters. In sharded clusters, mongo db instances will pass the write concern on to the shards.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.allow-multiple-dns
description: Whether search/query results are allowed to match on multiple DNs, or whether a single unique DN is expected for the result.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.saml-sp.ever-bridge.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.sms-provider.text-magic.username
description: Username authorized to use the service as the bind account.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.okta.proxy-host
description: Send requests via a proxy; define the hostname.

name: cas.authn.oauth.session-replication.cookie.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.pool.test-while-idle
description: Returns whether objects sitting idle in the pool will be validated by the idle object evictor ( if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). Validation is performed by the validateObject() method of the factory associated with the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be removed from the pool and destroyed.

name: cas.authn.radius.client.transport-type
description:
Transport type to use by this client to connect to the server. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code UDP}: Default. UDP client transport type.
  • {@code RADSEC}: RadSec is a protocol which allows RADIUS servers to transfer data over TCP and TLS for increased security.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.ca-certificate
description: CA Authority certificate from Kubernetes Master. Defaults to reading the certificate from the auto-injected file at: {@code /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.max-pool-size
description: Maximum LDAP connection pool size which the pool can use to grow.

name: cas.audit.mongo.authentication-database-name
description: Name of the database to use for authentication.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].recursive.merge-attributes
description: The Merge attributes.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.groovy[].case-insensitive
description:
Whether attribute repository should consider the underlying
attribute names in a case-insensitive manner.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.mdq.basic-authn-password
description: Basic auth password in case the metadata instance is connecting to an MDQ server.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.keystore-type
description: The type of keystore. {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.search-entry-handlers
description: Search handlers.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.rest.headers
description: Headers, defined as a Map, to include in the request when making the REST call. Will overwrite any header that CAS is pre-defined to send and include in the request. Key in the map should be the header name and the value in the map should be the header value.

name: cas.ticket.registry.ignite.key-store-password
description: Keystore password used to create a SSL context for the ticket registry.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.stub.attributes
description:
Static attributes that need to be mapped to a hardcoded value belong here. The structure follows a key-value pair where key is the attribute name and value is the attribute value. The key is the attribute fetched from the source and the value is the attribute name CAS should use for virtual renames.

Attributes may be allowed to be virtually renamed and remapped. The key in the attribute map is the original attribute, and the value should be the virtually-renamed attribute.

name: cas.saml-sp.rocket-chat.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.monitor.memcached.use-nagle-algorithm
description: Set to true if you'd like to enable the Nagle algorithm.

name: cas.authn.mongo.principal-id-attribute
description: Attribute that would be used to establish the authenticated profile.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.response-type
description:
The response type tells the authorization server which grant to execute.
For backward compatibility the default value is empty, which means the default pac4j ("code") response type is used.
Possibles values includes "code", "token" or "id_token".

name: cas.authn.oauth.uma.resource-set.jpa.dialect
description: The database dialect is a configuration setting for platform independent software (JPA, Hibernate, etc) which allows such software to translate its generic SQL statements into vendor specific DDL, DML.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.profile-selection.ldap.search-filter
description:
User filter to use for searching. Syntax is {@code cn={user}} or {@code cn={0}}.

You may also provide an external groovy script in the syntax of {@code file:/path/to/GroovyScript.groovy} to fully build the final filter template dynamically.

name: cas.service-registry.jpa.default-catalog
description: Qualifies unqualified table names with the given catalog in generated SQL.

name: cas.server.tomcat.http[].redirect-port
description:
If this Connector is supporting non-SSL requests,
this will automatically redirect
the request to the port number specified here.
Matching security constraints that require SSL transport will be auto-defined.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.subtree-search
description: Whether subtree searching is allowed.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.paypal.callback-url-type
description:
Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.jdbc.health-query
description: The SQL query to be executed to test the validity of connections. This is for "legacy" databases that do not support the JDBC4 {@code Connection.isValid()} API.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.discovery.multicast.timeout
description: specifies the time in seconds that a member should wait for a valid multicast response from another member running in the network before declaring itself the leader member (the first member joined to the cluster) and creating its own cluster. This only applies to the startup of members where no leader has been assigned yet. If you specify a high value, such as 60 seconds, it means that until a leader is selected, each member will wait 60 seconds before moving on. Be careful when providing a high value. Also, be careful not to set the value too low, or the members might give up too early and create their own cluster.

name: cas.authn.pm.forgot-username.google-recaptcha.invisible
description: Whether google reCAPTCHA invisible should be enabled.

name: cas.saml-sp.asana.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.multicast.trusted-interfaces
description: Multicast trusted interfaces for discovery. With the multicast auto-discovery mechanism, Hazelcast allows cluster members to find each other using multicast communication. The cluster members do not need to know the concrete addresses of the other members, as they just multicast to all the other members for listening. Whether multicast is possible or allowed depends on your environment.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].order
description: Order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.service-registry.amazon-s3.credential-access-key
description: Use access-key provided by AWS to authenticate.

name: cas.saml-sp.rocket-chat.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.authn.azure-active-directory.resource
description: Resource url for the graph API to fetch attributes.

name: cas.authn.x509.rfc822-email.alternate-principal-attribute
description:
Attribute name that will be used by X509 principal resolvers if the main attribute in the certificate is not present. This only applies to principal resolvers that are looking for attributes in the certificate that are not common to all certificates. (e.g. {@code SUBJECT_ALT_NAME}, {@code CN_EDIPI})

This assumes you would rather get something like the {@code subjectDn} rather than {@code null} where {@code null} would allow falling through to another authentication mechanism.

Currently supported values are: {@code subjectDn}, {@code sigAlgOid}, {@code subjectX500Principal}.

name: cas.authn.soap.name
description: The name of the authentication handler.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].prune-period
description:
Removes connections from the pool based on how long they have been idle in the available queue.
Run the pruning process at the indicated interval.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].password
description: The database connection password.

name: cas.authn.json.password-policy.warn-all
description: Always display the password expiration warning regardless.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.block-wait-time
description: The length of time the pool will block. By default the pool will block indefinitely and there is no guarantee that waiting threads will be serviced in the order in which they made their request. This option should be used with a blocking connection pool when you need to control the exact number of connections that can be created

name: cas.authn.json.password-encoder.secret
description: Secret to use with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#STANDARD}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT} password encoders. Secret usually is an optional setting.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.account-attribute-name
description: Name of LDAP attribute that holds GAuth account/credential as JSON.

name: cas.spring.cloud.dynamo-db.profile-path
description: Profile path.

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.membership-port
description: Multicast port (the port and the address together determine cluster membership. The multicast port, the default value is 45564 The multicast port, in conjunction with the address is what creates a cluster group. To divide up your farm into several different group, or to split up QA from production, change the port or the address

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.receiver-address
description: The address (network interface) to listen for incoming traffic.

name: cas.interrupt.core.trigger-mode
description:
Define how interrupt notifications should be triggered in the authentication flow. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code AFTER_AUTHENTICATION}: Trigger interrupt notifications and inquiry after authentication events and before single sign-on has been established.
  • {@code AFTER_SSO}: Trigger interrupt notifications and inquiry after single sign-on has been established. Interrupt queries that execute after single sign-on cannot control the creation of the SSO session conditionally.

name: cas.authn.mfa.duo[].duo-api-host
description: Duo API host and url.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.core.aup-attribute-name
description: AUP attribute to choose in order to determine whether policy has been accepted or not. The attribute is expected to contain a boolean value where {@code true} indicates policy has been accepted and {@code false} indicates otherwise. The attribute is fetched for the principal from configured sources and compared for the right match to determine policy status. If the attribute is not found, the policy status is considered as denied.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].properties
description: The WAN publisher properties.

name: cas.events.mongo.socket-keep-alive
description: Whether the database socket connection should be tagged with keep-alive.

name: cas.authn.trusted.person-directory.principal-resolution-conflict-strategy
description: In the event that the principal resolution engine resolves more than one principal, (specially if such principals in the chain have different identifiers), this setting determines strategy by which the principal id would be chosen from the chain. Accepted values are: {@code last}, {@code first}.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].principal-transformation.prefix
description: Prefix to add to the principal id prior to authentication.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.gcp.projects
description: A list of projects where the plugin looks for instances; if not set, the current project is used.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.response.credential-type
description:
Indicate the encoding type of the credential used when rendering the saml response. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code BASIC}: DER-Encoded format.
  • {@code X509}: PEM-encoded X509 format.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.fetch-size
description: Used to specify number of rows to be fetched in a select query.

name: cas.saml-sp.sa-manage.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.consent.redis.pool.max-idle
description: Max number of "idle" connections in the pool. Use a negative value to indicate an unlimited number of idle connections.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].generate-statistics
description: Allow hibernate to generate query statistics.

name: cas.service-registry.redis.pool.soft-min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)), with the extra condition that at least minIdle object instances remain in the pool. This setting is overridden by getMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis() (that is, if getMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis() is positive, then getSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis() is ignored).

name: cas.authn.oauth.code.remove-related-access-tokens
description: Remove the related access tokens when trying to use a code which is expired or no longer exists.

name: cas.authn.password-sync.ldap[].validator.scope
description: Search scope to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.consent.ldap.validator.type
description:
Determine the LDAP validator type.

The following LDAP validators can be used to test connection health status:

  • {@code search}: Validates a connection is healthy by performing a search operation. Validation is considered successful if the search result size is greater than zero.
  • {@code none}: No validation takes place.
  • {@code compare}: Validates a connection is healthy by performing a compare operation.

name: cas.authn.cloud-directory.socket-timeout
description: Socket timeout.

name: cas.authn.throttle.ldap.disable-pooling
description: Whether to use a pooled connection factory in components.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].collect-dn-attribute
description: When entry DN should be called as an attribute and stored into the principal.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].propagation-behavior-name
description: Defines the propagation behavior for transactions.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.network.ssl.key-manager-algorithm
description: Name of the algorithm based on which the authentication keys are provided.

name: cas.ticket.tgt.primary.max-time-to-live-in-seconds
description: Maximum time in seconds tickets would be live in CAS server.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.core.session-replication.cookie.crypto.encryption.key
description: The encryption key is a JWT whose length is defined by the encryption key size setting.

name: cas.service-registry.cosmos-db.preferred-regions
description: Sets the preferred regions for geo-replicated database accounts. For example, "East US" as the preferred region. When EnableEndpointDiscovery is true and PreferredRegions is non-empty, the SDK will prefer to use the regions in the container in the order they are specified to perform operations.

name: cas.saml-sp.slack.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.events.dynamo-db.client-execution-timeout
description: Client execution timeout.

name: cas.saml-sp.crash-plan.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].sasl-security-strength
description: SASL security strength.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.trust-store-password
description: Password needed to open the truststore.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.mongo.pool.max-size
description: Maximum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.zookeeper.group
description: Name of this Hazelcast cluster. You can have multiple distinct clusters to use the same ZooKeeper installation

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].attributes
description:
Map of attributes to fetch from the database.
Attributes are defined using a key-value structure
where CAS allows the attribute name/key to be renamed virtually
to a different attribute. The key is the attribute fetched
from the data source and the value is the attribute name CAS should
use for virtual renames.
Attributes may be allowed to be virtually renamed and remapped. The key in the
attribute map is the original attribute,
and the value should be the virtually-renamed attribute.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.docker-swarm.member-provider.skip-verify-ssl
description: If Swarm Mgr URI is SSL, to enable skip-verify for it.

name: cas.monitor.ldap[].pool.max-size
description:
Controls the maximum number of connections to keep
in the pool, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.wsfed[].attribute-resolver-enabled
description:
Whether CAS should enable its own attribute resolution machinery
after having received a response from wsfed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.connect-timeout
description: Connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.security-questions-enabled
description: Whether reset operations require security questions, or should they be marked as optional.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].requested-attributes.name-format
description: Attribute name format.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.rest.url
description: The endpoint URL to contact and retrieve attributes.

name: cas.saml-sp.qualtrics.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.server.tomcat.rewrite-valve.location
description: Location of a rewrite valve specifically by Apache Tomcat to activate URL rewriting.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.case-change.attribute-name-case-change
description: The Attribute name case change.

name: cas.saml-sp.benefit-focus.entity-ids
description: List of entityIds allowed for this service provider. Multiple ids can be specified in the event that the metadata is an aggregate.

name: cas.authn.syncope.password-encoder.strength
description: Strength or number of iterations to use for password hashing. Usually relevant when dealing with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT}. When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the salt strength.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.password
description: Login password of the redis server.

name: cas.audit.engine.include-validation-assertion
description: Whether ticket validation events in the audit log should include information about the assertion that is validated; things such as the principal id and attributes released.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.token-table-name
description: The table name used and created by CAS to hold tokens in DynamoDb.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].sasl-mechanism
description: The SASL mechanism.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.jpa.read-only
description: Configures the Connections to be added to the pool as read-only Connections.

name: cas.saml-sp.amazon.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.json
description: Retrieve attributes from multiple JSON file repositories.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.validator.type
description:
Determine the LDAP validator type.

The following LDAP validators can be used to test connection health status:

  • {@code search}: Validates a connection is healthy by performing a search operation. Validation is considered successful if the search result size is greater than zero.
  • {@code none}: No validation takes place.
  • {@code compare}: Validates a connection is healthy by performing a compare operation.

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.health-query
description: The SQL query to be executed to test the validity of connections. This is for "legacy" databases that do not support the JDBC4 {@code Connection.isValid()} API.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.validator.search-filter
description: Search filter to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.service-registry.amazon-s3.use-reaper
description: Flag that indicates whether to use reaper.

name: cas.authn.policy.unique-principal.enabled
description: Enables the policy.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.cluster.topology-refresh-period
description: Enables periodic refresh of cluster topology and sets the refresh period.

name: cas.webflow.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.spring.cloud.dynamo-db.region
description: AWS region used.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.windows-live.callback-url-type
description:
Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

  • {@code FREE_HEAP_SIZE}: Policy based on minimum free JVM heap memory in megabytes per JVM.
  • {@code FREE_NATIVE_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE}: Policy based on minimum free native memory percentage per Hazelcast instance.
  • {@code FREE_NATIVE_MEMORY_SIZE}: Policy based on minimum free native memory in megabytes per Hazelcast instance.
  • {@code PER_NODE}: Policy based on maximum number of entries stored per data structure (map, cache etc) on each Hazelcast instance.
  • {@code PER_PARTITION}: Policy based on maximum number of entries stored per data structure (map, cache etc) on each partition.
  • {@code USED_HEAP_PERCENTAGE}: Policy based on maximum used JVM heap memory percentage per data structure (map, cache etc) on each Hazelcast instance .
  • {@code USED_HEAP_SIZE}: Policy based on maximum used JVM heap memory in megabytes per data structure (map, cache etc) on each Hazelcast instance.
  • {@code USED_NATIVE_MEMORY_PERCENTAGE}: Policy based on maximum used native memory percentage per data structure (map, cache etc) on each Hazelcast instance.
  • {@code USED_NATIVE_MEMORY_SIZE}: Policy based on maximum used native memory in megabytes per data structure (map, cache etc) on each Hazelcast instance .

description: Sets the maximum number of objects to examine during each run (if any) of the idle object evictor thread. When positive, the number of tests performed for a run will be the minimum of the configured value and the number of idle instances in the pool. When negative, the number of tests performed will be ceil(getNumIdle()/ abs(getNumTestsPerEvictionRun())) which means that when the value is -n roughly one nth of the idle objects will be tested per run.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.search[].fail-fast-timeout
description:
Set the pool initialization failure timeout.
  • Any value greater than zero will be treated as a timeout for pool initialization. The calling thread will be blocked from continuing until a successful connection to the database, or until the timeout is reached. If the timeout is reached, then a {@code PoolInitializationException} will be thrown.
  • A value of zero will not prevent the pool from starting in the case that a connection cannot be obtained. However, upon start the pool will attempt to obtain a connection and validate that the {@code connectionTestQuery} and {@code connectionInitSql} are valid. If those validations fail, an exception will be thrown. If a connection cannot be obtained, the validation is skipped and the the pool will start and continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
  • A value less than zero will not bypass any connection attempt and validation during startup, and therefore the pool will start immediately. The pool will continue to try to obtain connections in the background. This can mean that callers to {@code DataSource#getConnection()} may encounter exceptions.
Note that if this timeout value is greater than or equal to zero (0), and therefore an initial connection validation is performed, this timeout does not override the {@code connectionTimeout} or {@code validationTimeout}; they will be honored before this timeout is applied. The default value is one millisecond.

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.expire-sessions-on-shutdown

name: cas.consent.ldap.connection-strategy
description:
If multiple URLs are provided as the ldapURL this describes how each URL will be processed.
  • {@code ACTIVE_PASSIVE} First LDAP will be used for every request unless it fails and then the next shall be used.
  • {@code ROUND_ROBIN} For each new connection the next url in the list will be used.
  • {@code RANDOM} For each new connection a random LDAP url will be selected.
  • {@code DNS_SRV} LDAP urls based on DNS SRV records of the configured/given LDAP url will be used.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.core.backup-count
description: To provide data safety, Hazelcast allows you to specify the number of backup copies you want to have. That way, data on a cluster member will be copied onto other member(s). To create synchronous backups, select the number of backup copies. When this count is 1, a map entry will have its backup on one other member in the cluster. If you set it to 2, then a map entry will have its backup on two other members. You can set it to 0 if you do not want your entries to be backed up, e.g., if performance is more important than backing up. The maximum value for the backup count is 6. Sync backup operations have a blocking cost which may lead to latency issues.

description: The signing key size.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.linked-in.client-name
description: Name of the client mostly for UI purposes and uniqueness. This name, with 'non-word' characters converted to '-' (e.g. "This Org (New)" becomes "This-Org--New-") is added to the "class" attribute of the redirect link on the login page, to allow for custom styling of individual IdPs (e.g. for an organization logo).

name: cas.account-registration.google-recaptcha.secret
description: The google reCAPTCHA site secret.

name: cas.authn.oidc.discovery.claims-parameter-supported
description: Specifying whether this provider supports use of the claims parameter.

name: cas.monitor.memcached.transcoder
description:
Indicate the transcoder type. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code KRYO}: CAS transcoder implementation based on Kryo fast serialization framework suited for efficient serialization of tickets. Provides pooling mechanisms as well as control over object registration and sequences.
  • {@code SERIAL}: Kryp native transcoder that serializes and compresses objects.
  • {@code WHALIN}: Transcoder that provides compatibility with Greg Whalin's memcached client.
  • {@code WHALINV1}: Handles old whalin encoding: data type is in the first byte of the value.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.dialect
description: The database dialect is a configuration setting for platform independent software (JPA, Hibernate, etc) which allows such software to translate its generic SQL statements into vendor specific DDL, DML.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.bind[].credential-criteria
description:
A number of authentication handlers are allowed to determine whether they can operate on the provided credential and as such lend themselves to be tried and tested during the authentication handler selection phase. The credential criteria may be one of the following options:
  • 1) A regular expression pattern that is tested against the credential identifier.
  • 2) A fully qualified class name of your own design that implements {@code Predicate}.
  • 3) Path to an external Groovy script that implements the same interface.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.pool.name
description: Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].search-filter
description:
User filter to use for searching. Syntax is {@code cn={user}} or {@code cn={0}}.

You may also provide an external groovy script in the syntax of {@code file:/path/to/GroovyScript.groovy} to fully build the final filter template dynamically.

name: cas.authn.reject.name
description: Name of the authentication handler.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.discovery.azure.group-name
description: The Azure resource group name of the cluster. You can find this in the Azure portal or CLI.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.jdbc.ddl-auto
description:
Hibernate feature to automatically validate and exports DDL to the schema. By default, creates and drops the schema automatically when a session is starts and ends. Setting the value to {@code validate} or {@code none} may be more desirable for production, but any of the following options can be used:
  • {@code validate}: Validate the schema, but make no changes to the database.
  • {@code update}: Update the schema.
  • {@code create}: Create the schema, destroying previous data.
  • {@code create-drop}: Drop the schema at the end of the session.
  • {@code none}: Do nothing.

Note that during a version migration where any schema has changed {@code create-drop} will result in the loss of all data as soon as CAS is started. For transient data like tickets this is probably not an issue, but in cases like the audit table important data could be lost. Using `update`, while safe for data, is confirmed to result in invalid database state. {@code validate} or {@code none} settings are likely the only safe options for production use.

For more info, see this.

name: cas.sms-provider.rest.method
description: HTTP method to use when contacting the rest endpoint. Examples include {@code GET, POST}, etc.

name: cas.authn.x509.principal.principal-transformation.pattern
description: A regular expression that will be used against the provided username for username extractions. On a successful match, the first matched group in the pattern will be used as the extracted username.

name: cas.authn.mfa.triggers.grouper.grouper-group-field
description: MFA can be triggered by Grouper groups to which the authenticated principal is assigned. Groups are collected by CAS and then cross-checked against all available/configured MFA providers. The group’s comparing factor MUST be defined in CAS to activate this behavior and it can be based on the group’s name, display name, etc where a successful match against a provider id shall activate the chosen MFA provider.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.redis.password
description: Login password of the redis server.

name: cas.authn.radius.client.shared-secret
description: Secret/password to use for the initial bind.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.mongo.user-id
description: MongoDb database user for authentication.

name: cas.authn.syncope.principal-transformation.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.crypto.alg
description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.binary-attributes
