name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.rest.headers
description: Headers, defined as a Map, to include in the request when making the REST call. Will overwrite any header that CAS is pre-defined to send and include in the request. Key in the map should be the header name and the value in the map should be the header value.

name: cas.authn.okta.proxy-host
description: Send requests via a proxy; define the hostname.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.mail.from

name: cas.saml-sp.cher-well.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.wsfed[].auto-redirect-type
description: Whether CAS should auto redirect to this wsfed instance.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.sasl-security-strength
description: SASL security strength.

name: cas.monitor.ldap[].pool.name
description:
Set the name of the connection pool. This is primarily used for
the MBean to uniquely identify the pool configuration.

name: cas.authn.cognito.max-connections
description: Maximum connections setting.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].case-change.attribute-names
description: The Attribute names.

name: cas.sms-provider.sns.region
description: AWS region used.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.rest.crypto.enabled
description: Whether crypto operations are enabled.

name: cas.consent.ldap.validator.dn
description: DN to compare to use for the compare validator.

name: cas.ticket.registry.memcached.min-idle
description: Get the value for the minIdle configuration attribute for pools created with this configuration instance.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].partial-logout-as-success
description:
Logouts are only successful if the IdP was able to inform all services, otherwise it will
respond with {@code PartialLogout}. This setting allows clients such as CAS to ignore such server-side behavior.
If the IdP reports back a partial logout, this setting instructs CAS whether it should accept or deny that response.

name: cas.authn.x509.principal-transformation.suffix
description: Suffix to add to the principal id prior to authentication.

name: cas.authn.throttle.jdbc.default-catalog
description: Qualifies unqualified table names with the given catalog in generated SQL.

name: cas.saml-core.issuer
description: Issuer of the assertion when generating SAML1 responses.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].keycloak.callback-url-type
description:
Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

name: cas.authn.json.principal-transformation.pattern
description: A regular expression that will be used against the provided username for username extractions. On a successful match, the first matched group in the pattern will be used as the extracted username.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.jpa.data-source-name
description: Attempts to do a JNDI data source look up for the data source name specified. Will attempt to locate the data source object as is.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.ldap.sasl-realm
description: The SASL realm.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].pool.max-size
description:
Controls the maximum number of connections to keep
in the pool, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.core.max-no-heartbeat-seconds
description: Max timeout of heartbeat in seconds for a node to assume it is dead.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.merge-attribute.merge-attribute-name
description: The Merge attribute name.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].keycloak.disable-pkce
description: Disable PKCE support for the provider.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.sql-find-phone
description: SQL query to locate the user phone number.

name: cas.saml-sp.new-relic.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.mongo.collection
description: MongoDb database collection name to fetch and/or create.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.cas[].client-name
description:
Name of the client mostly for UI purposes and uniqueness.
This name, with 'non-word' characters converted to '-' (e.g. "This Org (New)" becomes "This-Org--New-")
is added to the "class" attribute of the redirect link on the login page, to allow for
custom styling of individual IdPs (e.g. for an organization logo).

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.batch-size
description: A non-zero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. e.g. recommended values between 5 and 30.

name: cas.view.template-prefixes
description: Comma separated paths to where CAS templates may be found. Example might be {@code classpath:templates,file:/templates}.

name: cas.saml-sp.in-common.name-id-attribute
description: Attribute to use when generating nameids for this SP.

name: cas.server.tomcat.ajp.enabled
description: Enable AJP support in CAS for the embedded Apache Tomcat container.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.redis.pool.fairness
description: Returns whether or not the pool serves threads waiting to borrow objects fairly. True means that waiting threads are served as if waiting in a FIFO queue.

name: cas.authn.mfa.yubikey.redis.database
description: Database index used by the connection factory.

name: cas.account-registration.mail.cc
description: Email CC address, if any.

name: cas.saml-sp.cccco.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.git.ssh-session-password
description: As with using SSH with public keys, an SSH session with {@code ssh://user@example.com/repo.git} must be specified to use password-secured SSH connections.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.docker-swarm.member-provider.swarm-mgr-uri
description: Swarm Manager URI (overrides DOCKER_HOST).

name: cas.monitor.memcached.servers
description: Comma-separated list of memcached servers.

name: cas.saml-sp.zendesk.entity-ids
description: List of entityIds allowed for this service provider. Multiple ids can be specified in the event that the metadata is an aggregate.

name: cas.service-registry.cosmos-db.create-container
description: Whether collections should be created on startup.

name: cas.consent.redis.cluster.nodes[].id
description: Identifier of this node.

name: cas.authn.syncope.password-encoder.iterations
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the required number of iterations.

name: cas.server.tomcat.http-proxy.enabled
description: Enable the container running in proxy mode.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.jaas.refresh-configuration-on-startup
description: If set, a call to {@code Configuration#refresh()} will be made by {@code #configureJaas(Resource)} method.

name: cas.ticket.registry.mongo.drop-indexes
description: When updating/creating indexes, decide if existing indexes should all be dropped once prior to creating/updating indexes. This may be useful to avoid conflicts between old and new indexes, in scenarios where CAS may be unable to locate the proper difference in index options or names during upgrades..

name: cas.authn.jaas[].login-config-type
description:
Typically set to {@code JavaLoginConfig} which is the default Configuration implementation
from the SUN provider. This type accepts a URI/path to a configuration file as a valid parameter type specified via {@link #loginConfigurationFile}.
If this parameter is not specified, then the configuration information is loaded from the sources described
in the ConfigFile class specification. If this parameter is specified, the configuration information is loaded solely from the specified URI.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.mongo.pool.max-size
description: Maximum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.azure-active-directory[].order
description:
The order of this attribute repository in the chain of repositories.
Can be used to explicitly position this source in chain and affects
merging strategies.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].google.preferred-jws-algorithm
description:
The JWS algorithm to use forcefully when validating ID tokens.
If none is defined, the first algorithm from metadata will be used.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.saml-sp.web-advisor.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.audit.mongo.pool.per-host
description: Total number of connections allowed per host.

name: cas.authn.json.principal-transformation.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.redis.cluster.nodes[].port
description: Server's port number.

name: cas.authn.jaas[].realm
description: JAAS realm to use.

name: cas.service-registry.mongo.user-id
description: MongoDb database user for authentication.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.min-pool-size
description: Minimum LDAP connection pool size. Size the pool should be initialized to and pruned to

name: cas.server.tomcat.basic-authn.security-roles
description: Security roles for the CAS application.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.secrets-manager.retry-mode
description: Outline the requested retry mode. Accepted values are {@code STANDARD, LEGACY}.

name: cas.authn.mfa.inwebo.site-alias
description: The alias of the secured site.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].mapped-attributes
description:
Describes the map of attributes that are to be fetched from the credential (map keys)
and then transformed/renamed using map values before they are put into a profile.
An example might be to fetch {@code givenName} from credential and rename it to {@code urn:oid:2.5.4.42} or vice versa.
Note that this setting only applies to attribute names, and not friendly-names.
List arbitrary mappings of claims. Uses a "directed list" where the allowed
syntax would be {@code givenName->urn:oid:2.5.4.42}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].keycloak.token-expiration-advance
description: Default time period advance (in seconds) for considering an access token expired.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.auto-redirect-type
description: Auto-redirect to this client.

name: cas.audit.mongo.asynchronous
description: Execute the recording of audit records in async manner. This setting must almost always be set to true.

name: cas.account-registration.google-recaptcha.enabled
description: Whether google reCAPTCHA should be enabled.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.generate-statistics
description: Allow hibernate to generate query statistics.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].credential-criteria
description:
A number of authentication handlers are allowed to determine whether they can operate on the provided credential and as such lend themselves to be tried and tested during the authentication handler selection phase. The credential criteria may be one of the following options:
  • 1) A regular expression pattern that is tested against the credential identifier.
  • 2) A fully qualified class name of your own design that implements {@code Predicate}.
  • 3) Path to an external Groovy script that implements the same interface.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.github.css-class
description: CSS class that should be assigned to this client.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.jdbc.dialect
description: The database dialect is a configuration setting for platform independent software (JPA, Hibernate, etc) which allows such software to translate its generic SQL statements into vendor specific DDL, DML.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].recursive.search-attribute
description: The Search attribute.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.network.port
description: You can specify the ports which Hazelcast will use to communicate between cluster members. The name of the parameter for this is port and its default value is 5701. By default, Hazelcast will try 100 ports to bind. Meaning that, if you set the value of port as 5701, as members are joining to the cluster, Hazelcast tries to find ports between 5701 and 5801.

name: cas.authn.soap.password-encoder.hash-length
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2}, it indicates the hash strength/length.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.ldap.validator.base-dn
description: Base DN to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.sms-provider.sns.connection-timeout
description: Connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].apple.callback-url-type
description:
Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

name: cas.saml-sp.sans-sth.name-id-format
description: The forced nameId format to use when generating a response.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.facebook.secret
description: The client secret.

name: cas.saml-sp.arms-software.sign-responses
description: Indicate whether responses should be signed.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.keystore-type
description: The type of keystore. {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.geo-location.google-maps.api-key
description: Authenticate into google maps via an API key.

name: cas.rest.services.attribute-value
description: Matching authorization attribute value, pulled from the attribute required by the REST endpoint in order to allow for the requested operation. The attribute value may also be constructed as a regex pattern.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.max-wait
description: When monitoring the JDBC connection pool, indicates the amount of time the operation must wait before it times outs and considers the pool in bad shape.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.dynamo-db.use-reaper
description: Flag that indicates whether to use reaper.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].password-policy.warn-all
description: Always display the password expiration warning regardless.

name: cas.events.mongo.read-preference
description:
Read preference. Accepted values are:
  • {@code PRIMARY}
  • {@code SECONDARY}
  • {@code SECONDARY_PREFERRED}
  • {@code PRIMARY_PREFERRED}
  • {@code NEAREST}

name: cas.saml-sp.famis.description
description: Description of this service provider as it's stored in the registry.

name: cas.ticket.registry.mongo.pool.max-size
description: Maximum number of connections to keep around.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.core.recover-exceptions
description: Recover from LDAP exceptions and continue with partial results. Otherwise, die and do not allow to log in.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.ldap.keystore-type
description: The type of keystore. {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.redis.crypto.encryption.key-size
description: The encryption key size.

name: cas.authn.throttle.jdbc.pool.keep-alive-time
description: This property controls the keepalive interval for a connection in the pool. An in-use connection will never be tested by the keepalive thread, only when it is idle will it be tested. Default is zero, which disables this feature.

name: cas.service-registry.jpa.properties
description: Additional settings provided by Hibernate (or the connection provider) in form of key-value pairs.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].properties
description: The WAN publisher properties.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.cookie.auto-configure-cookie-path
description: Decide if cookie paths should be automatically configured based on the application context path, when the cookie path is not configured.

name: cas.authn.x509.serial-no-dn.value-delimiter
description: Value delimiter used for principal resolution when type is set to {@link X509Properties.PrincipalTypes#SERIAL_NO_DN}.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.s3.profile-path
description: Profile path.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.targets[].executor-thread-count
description:
The number of threads that the replication executor will have. The executor is used to send WAN
events to the endpoints and ideally you want to have one thread per endpoint. If this property is omitted
and you have specified the endpoints property, this will be the case. If necessary you can manually define
the number of threads that the executor will use. Once the executor has been initialized there is thread
affinity between the discovered endpoints and the executor threads - all events for a single endpoint will
go through a single executor thread, preserving event order. It is important to determine which number of
executor threads is a good value. Failure to do so can lead to performance issues - either contention on a
too small number of threads or wasted threads that will not be performing any work.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.core.id
description: The identifier for the multifactor provider. In most cases, this need not be configured explicitly, unless multiple instances of the same provider type are configured in CAS.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].pool.maximum-lifetime
description:
This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool. When a connection
reaches this timeout, even if recently used,
it will be retired from the pool. An in-use connection will never be retired, only when it is idle will it be removed.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.cas[].callback-url-type
description:
Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].disable-pooling
description: Whether to use a pooled connection factory in components.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.block-wait-time
description: The length of time the pool will block. By default the pool will block indefinitely and there is no guarantee that waiting threads will be serviced in the order in which they made their request. This option should be used with a blocking connection pool when you need to control the exact number of connections that can be created

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.trust-store-password
description: Password needed to open the truststore.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.recursive.merge-attributes
description: The Merge attributes.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].metadata.service-provider.jdbc.driver-class
description: The JDBC driver used to connect to the database.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.mongo.client-uri
description: The connection uri to the mongodb instance. This typically takes on the form of {@code mongodb://user:psw@ds135522.somewhere.com:35522/db}. If not specified, will fallback onto other individual settings. If specified, takes over all other settings where applicable.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.dynamo-db.prevent-table-creation-on-startup
description: Flag that indicates whether to prevent CAS from creating tables.

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.docker-swarm.dns-provider.enabled
description: Enable provider.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.crypto.alg
description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.service-registry.amazon-s3.profile-path
description: Profile path.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].search-entry-handlers.recursive.search-attribute
description: The Search attribute.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.jpa.pool.max-size
description: Controls the maximum number of connections to keep in the pool, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.monitor.memcached.max-total
description: Sets the cap on the number of objects that can be allocated by the pool (checked out to clients, or idle awaiting checkout) at a given time. Use a negative value for no limit.

name: cas.service-registry.templates.directory.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.jdbc[].pool.min-size
description:
Controls the minimum size that the pool is allowed
to reach, including both idle and in-use connections.

name: cas.spring.cloud.aws.dynamo-db.use-reaper
description: Flag that indicates whether to use reaper.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.mongo.password
description: MongoDb database password for authentication.

name: cas.authn.pm.forgot-username.google-recaptcha.activate-for-ip-address-pattern
description: A regular expression pattern to indicate that captcha should be activated when the remote IP address matches this pattern, and otherwise skipped and disabled.

name: cas.monitor.endpoints.jdbc.password-encoder.iterations
description: When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the required number of iterations.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].type
description:
The type of search entry handler to choose. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_REFERRAL}: Provides handling of an ldap referral for search operations.
  • {@code FOLLOW_SEARCH_RESULT_REFERENCE}: Provides handling of an ldap continuation reference for search operations.
  • {@code ACTIVE_DIRECTORY}: Process the entry results fetched from active directory and check for account status controls for disabled/expired accounts, etc.
  • {@code OBJECT_GUID}: Object guid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectGUID} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code OBJECT_SID}: Object sid search entry handler. Handles the {@code objectSid} attribute fetching and conversion.
  • {@code CASE_CHANGE}: Case change search entry handler. Provides the ability to modify the case of search entry DNs, attribute names, and attribute values.
  • {@code DN_ATTRIBUTE_ENTRY}: DN attribute entry handler. Adds the entry DN as an attribute to the result set. Provides a client side implementation of RFC 5020.
  • {@code MERGE}: Merge search entry handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes into a single attribute.
  • {@code PRIMARY_GROUP}: Primary group search handler. Constructs the primary group SID and then searches for that group and puts it's DN in the {@code memberOf} attribute of the original search entry.
  • {@code RANGE_ENTRY}: Range entry search handler. Rewrites attributes returned from Active Directory to include all values by performing additional searches.
  • {@code RECURSIVE_ENTRY}: Recursive entry search handler. This recursively searches based on a supplied attribute and merges those results into the original entry.
  • {@code MERGE_ENTRIES}: Merge entries handler. Merges the values of one or more attributes in all entries into a single attribute. The merged attribute may or may not already exist on the entry. If it does exist it's existing values will remain intact.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.use-start-tls
description: Whether TLS should be used and enabled when establishing the connection.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.ca-certificate
description: CA Authority certificate from Kubernetes Master. Defaults to reading the certificate from the auto-injected file at: {@code /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt}.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.crypto.signing.key
description: The signing key is a JWT whose length is defined by the signing key size setting.

name: cas.saml-sp.poll-everywhere.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.yahoo.display-name
description: Indicate the title or display name of the client for decoration and client presentation purposes. If left blank, the client original name would be used by default.

name: cas.saml-sp.easy-iep.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.saml-sp.evernote.name-id-format
description: The forced nameId format to use when generating a response.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.foursquare.auto-redirect-type
description:
Auto-redirect to this client. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code SERVER}: Redirect on the server side, typically making CAS invisible.
  • {@code CLIENT}: Redirect on the client side using browser redirects, etc.
  • {@code NONE}: Do nothing and let the selection take place manually.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.core.enable-compression
description: Enables compression when default java serialization is used.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.core.logging-type
description:
Hazelcast has a flexible logging configuration and doesn't depend on any logging framework except JDK logging. It has in-built adaptors for a number of logging frameworks and also supports custom loggers by providing logging interfaces. To use built-in adaptors you should set this setting to one of predefined types below.
  • {@code jdk}: JDK logging
  • {@code log4j}: Log4j
  • {@code slf4j}: Slf4j
  • {@code none}: Disable logging

name: cas.service-registry.redis.connect-timeout
description: Connection timeout.

name: cas.authn.okta.proxy-password
description: Send requests via a proxy; define the proxy password.

name: cas.authn.gua.ldap.trust-store
description: Path to the keystore used to determine which certificates or certificate authorities should be trusted. Used when connecting to an LDAP server via LDAPS or startTLS connection. If left blank, the default truststore for the Java runtime is used.

name: cas.webflow.crypto.encryption.key-size
description: Encryption key size.

name: cas.saml-sp.confluence.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.network.ssl.cipher-suites
description: Comma-separated list of cipher suite names allowed to be used. Its default value are all supported suites in your Java runtime.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].generic.callback-url-type
description:
Determine how the callback url should be resolved. Default is {@link CallbackUrlTypes#QUERY_PARAMETER}. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PATH_PARAMETER}: Path parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of the callback URL.
  • {@code QUERY_PARAMETER}: Query parameter callback url. The client name is added to the path of a query parameter.
  • {@code NONE}: No callback url. No name is added to the callback URL to be able to distinguish the client.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.rest[].id
description: A value can be assigned to this field to uniquely identify this resolver.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.jdbc.batch-size
description: A non-zero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. e.g. recommended values between 5 and 30.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.billing-mode
description:
Billing mode specifies how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code PROVISIONED}: Provisioned mode means that you specify the number of reads and writes per second that you expect your application to use. Provisioned mode is a good option if any of the following are true:
    • You have predictable application traffic.
    • You run applications whose traffic is consistent or ramps gradually.
    • You can forecast capacity requirements to control costs.
    You can use auto scaling to automatically adjust capacity based on the specified utilization rate to ensure application performance while reducing costs.
  • {@code PAY_PER_REQUEST}: Pay-per-request or on-demand billing means that you're charged for only the read/write requests that you use. On-demand mode is a good option if any of the following are true:
    • You create new tables with unknown workloads.
    • You have unpredictable application traffic.
    • You prefer the ease of paying for only what you use.
    Tables using on-demand mode support all DynamoDB features (such as encryption at rest, point-in-time recovery, global tables, and so on) with the exception of auto scaling, which is not applicable with this mode.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis

name: cas.webflow.session.server.hazelcast.cluster.core.partition-member-group-type
description:
With {@code PartitionGroupConfig}, you can control how primary and backup partitions are mapped to physical Members. Hazelcast will always place partitions on different partition groups so as to provide redundancy. Accepted value are: {@code PER_MEMBER, HOST_AWARE, CUSTOM, ZONE_AWARE, SPI}. In all cases a partition will never be created on the same group. If there are more partitions defined than there are partition groups, then only those partitions, up to the number of partition groups, will be created. For example, if you define 2 backups, then with the primary, that makes 3. If you have only two partition groups only two will be created.
  • {@code}PER_MEMBER Partition Groups}: This is the default partition scheme and is used if no other scheme is defined. Each Member is in a group of its own.
  • {@code}HOST_AWARE Partition Groups}: In this scheme, a group corresponds to a host, based on its IP address. Partitions will not be written to any other members on the same host. This scheme provides good redundancy when multiple instances are being run on the same host.
  • {@code}CUSTOM Partition Groups}: In this scheme, IP addresses, or IP address ranges, are allocated to groups. Partitions are not written to the same group. This is very useful for ensuring partitions are written to different racks or even availability zones.
  • {@code}ZONE_AWARE Partition Groups}: In this scheme, groups are allocated according to the metadata provided by Discovery SPI Partitions are not written to the same group. This is very useful for ensuring partitions are written to availability zones or different racks without providing the IP addresses to the config ahead.
  • {@code}SPI Partition Groups}: In this scheme, groups are allocated according to the implementation provided by Discovery SPI.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

description: The maximum age of the cookie, specified in seconds. By default, {@code -1} indicating the cookie will persist until browser shutdown. A positive value indicates that the cookie will expire after that many seconds have passed. Note that the value is the maximum age when the cookie will expire, not the cookie's current age. A negative value means that the cookie is not stored persistently and will be deleted when the Web browser exits. A zero value causes the cookie to be deleted.

description: Secret/password to use for the initial bind.

name: cas.authn.oidc.registration.client-secret-expiration
description: When client secret is issued by CAS, this is the period that gets added to the current time measured in UTC to determine the client secret's expiration date. An example value would be {@code P14D} forcing client applications to expire their client secret in 2 weeks after the registration date. Expired client secrets can be updated using the client configuration endpoint. A value of {@code 0} indicates that client secrets would never expire.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.mongo.database-name
description: MongoDb database instance name.

name: cas.ticket.registry.ignite.tickets-cache.cache-mode
description:
Specified the caching mode.
  • {@code LOCAL}: Specifies local-only cache behaviour. In this mode caches residing on different grid nodes will not know about each other. Other than distribution, local caches still have all the caching features, such as eviction, expiration, swapping, querying, etc... This mode is very useful when caching read-only data or data that automatically expires at a certain interval and then automatically reloaded from persistence store.
  • {@code REPLICATED}: Specifies fully replicated cache behavior. In this mode all the keys are distributed to all participating nodes. User still has affinity control over subset of nodes for any given key via AffinityFunction configuration.
  • {@code PARTITIONED}: Specifies partitioned cache behaviour. In this mode the overall key set will be divided into partitions and all partitions will be split equally between participating nodes. User has affinity control over key assignment via AffinityFunction configuration. Note that partitioned cache is always fronted by local 'near' cache which stores most recent data. You can configure the size of near cache via NearCacheConfiguration.getNearEvictionPolicy() configuration property.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.jpa.pool.maximum-lifetime
description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool. When a connection reaches this timeout, even if recently used, it will be retired from the pool. An in-use connection will never be retired, only when it is idle will it be removed.

description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.saml-sp.academic-health-plans.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.mfa.inwebo.name
description: The name of the authentication handler used to verify credentials in MFA. Remember that if you have more than one authentication handler of the same type, the names must be defined uniquely for each authentication scheme. Failing to do so may force CAS to not register authentication handlers with a duplicate name.

name: cas.saml-sp.confluence.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.spring.cloud.dynamo-db.drop-tables-on-startup

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.azure.cluster-id
description: The name of the tag on the hazelcast vm resources. With every Hazelcast Virtual Machine you deploy in your resource group, you need to ensure that each VM is tagged with the value of cluster-id defined in your Hazelcast configuration. The only requirement is that every VM can access each other either by private or public IP address.

name: cas.saml-sp.bynder.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mail.reply-to

name: cas.audit.engine.audit-format
description:
The audit format to use in the logs. Available values are as follows:
  • {@code DEFAULT}: Default audit format.
  • {@code JSON}: Output audit logs as JSON strings where necessary/possible.

name: cas.authn.oauth.csrf-cookie.name
description: Cookie name. Constructs a cookie with a specified name and value. The name must conform to RFC 2965. That means it can contain only ASCII alphanumeric characters and cannot contain commas, semicolons, or white space or begin with a {@code $} character. The cookie's name cannot be changed after creation. By default, cookies are created according to the RFC 2965 cookie specification. Cookie names are automatically calculated assigned by CAS at runtime, and there is usually no need to customize the name or assign it a different value unless a special use case warrants the change.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.core.slo-service-post-binding-enabled
description: Whether metadata generation process should support SLO service POST binding.

name: cas.ticket.registry.jpa.leak-threshold
description: Controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].default-catalog
description: Qualifies unqualified table names with the given catalog in generated SQL.

name: cas.monitor.jdbc.isolate-internal-queries
description:
This property determines whether data source isolates internal pool queries, such as the connection alive test, in their own transaction.

Since these are typically read-only queries, it is rarely necessary to encapsulate them in their own transaction. This property only applies if {@link #autocommit} is disabled.

name: cas.authn.redis.pool.min-evictable-idle-time-millis
description: Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any - see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.ldap.trust-store-type
description: The type of trust keystore that determines which certificates or certificate authorities are trusted. Types depend on underlying java platform, typically {@code PKCS12} or {@code JKS}. If left blank, defaults to the default keystore type indicated by the underlying Java platform.

name: cas.saml-sp.gartner.metadata
description: The location of the metadata for this service provider. Can be a URL or another form of resource.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.mongo.write-concern
description: Write concern describes the level of acknowledgement requested from MongoDB for write operations to a standalone mongo db or to replica sets or to sharded clusters. In sharded clusters, mongo db instances will pass the write concern on to the shards.

name: cas.saml-sp.box.attributes
description: Set up the attribute release policy for this service. Allow attributes that are to be released to this SP. Attributes should be separated by commas and can be virtually mapped and renamed.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.mongo.read-concern
description:
Read concern. Accepted values are:
  • {@code LOCAL}
  • {@code MAJORITY}
  • {@code LINEARIZABLE}
  • {@code SNAPSHOT}
  • {@code AVAILABLE}

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.core.bypass.credential-class-type
description: Skip multifactor authentication depending on form of primary credentials. Value must equal the fully qualified class name of the credential type.

name: cas.authn.spnego.ldap.connection-strategy
description:
If multiple URLs are provided as the ldapURL this describes how each URL will be processed.
  • {@code ACTIVE_PASSIVE} First LDAP will be used for every request unless it fails and then the next shall be used.
  • {@code ROUND_ROBIN} For each new connection the next url in the list will be used.
  • {@code RANDOM} For each new connection a random LDAP url will be selected.
  • {@code DNS_SRV} LDAP urls based on DNS SRV records of the configured/given LDAP url will be used.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.discovery.aws.port
description: Hazelcast port. Typically may be set to {@code 5701}. You can set searching for other ports rather than 5701 if you've members on different ports.

Secret to use with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#STANDARD}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2},

Secret usually is an optional setting.

The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. Multiple host addresses may be defined, separated by comma.
If more than one host is defined, it is assumed that each host contains the port as well, if any.
Otherwise the configuration may fallback onto the port defined.

When used by {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#ARGON2} or {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, it indicates the salt strength.

If the CRL has expired, activate the this policy. Activated if {@link #revocationChecker} is {@code CRL}. Accepted values are:
  • {@code ALLOW}: Allow authentication to proceed.
  • {@code DENY}: Deny authentication and block.
  • {@code THRESHOLD}: Applicable to CRL expiration, throttle the request whereby expired data is permitted up to a threshold period of time but not afterward.

syntax would be {@code claim->attribute}.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.http.metadata-backup-location
description: Directory location where downloaded SAML metadata is cached as backup files. If left undefined, the directory is calculated off of the metadata location on disk when specified. The directory location should also support and be resolvable via Spring expression language.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.mail.subject
description:
Email subject line.

The subject can either be defined verbaitm, or it may point to a message key in the language bundle using the syntax {@code #{subject-language-key}}. This key should point to a valid message defined in the appropriate language bundle that is then picked up via the active locale. In case where the language code cannot resolve the real subject, a default subject value would be used.

name: cas.ticket.crypto.signing.key-size
description: The signing key size.

name: cas.service-registry.stream.hazelcast.config.cluster.network.ssl.trust-store-type
description: Type of the truststore. Its default value is JKS. Another commonly used type is the PKCS12. Available keystore/truststore types depend on your Operating system and the Java runtime.

name: cas.monitor.memcached.hash-algorithm
description: Hash algorithm. Acceptable values are {@code NATIVE_HASH,CRC_HASH,FNV1_64_HASH,FNV1A_64_HASH,FNV1_32_HASH,FNV1A_32_HASH,KETAMA_HASH}.

name: cas.authn.pm.ldap[].search-filter
description:
User filter to use for searching. Syntax is {@code cn={user}} or {@code cn={0}}.

You may also provide an external groovy script in the syntax of {@code file:/path/to/GroovyScript.groovy} to fully build the final filter template dynamically.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.tokens.mongo.host
description: MongoDb database host for authentication. Multiple host addresses may be defined, separated by comma. If more than one host is defined, it is assumed that each host contains the port as well, if any. Otherwise the configuration may fallback onto the port defined.

name: cas.sms-provider.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.redis.timeout
description: Command timeout.

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].dn-attribute.dn-attribute-name
description: The Dn attribute name.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.twitter.callback-url
description: Callback URL to use to return the flow back to the CAS server one the identity provider is successfully done. This may be used at the discretion of the client and its type to build service parameters, redirect URIs, etc. If none is specified, the CAS server's login endpoint will be used as the basis of the final callback url.

name: cas.authn.passwordless.accounts.ldap.validator.search-filter
description: Search filter to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.jdbc.encode[].order
description: Order of the authentication handler in the chain.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.redis.scan-count
description: Redis scan count option. When and if specified, SCAN operations would be "counted" or limited by this serting. While SCAN does not provide guarantees about the number of elements returned at every iteration, it is possible to empirically adjust the behavior of SCAN using the COUNT option. Basically with COUNT the user specified the amount of work that should be done at every call in order to retrieve elements from the collection. This is just a hint for the implementation, however generally speaking this is what you could expect most of the times from the implementation.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.jpa.pool.maximum-lifetime
description: This property controls the maximum lifetime of a connection in the pool. When a connection reaches this timeout, even if recently used, it will be retired from the pool. An in-use connection will never be retired, only when it is idle will it be removed.

name: cas.saml-sp.salesforce.signature-location
description: Signature location used to verify metadata.

name: cas.ticket.registry.redis.pool.enabled
description: Enable the pooling configuration.

name: cas.consent.ldap.bind-dn
description:
The bind DN to use when connecting to LDAP. LDAP connection configuration injected into the LDAP connection pool can be initialized with the following parameters:
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} provided - Use the provided credentials to bind when initializing connections.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to {@code *} - Use a fast-bind strategy to initialize the pool.
  • {@code bindDn/bindCredential} set to blank - Skip connection initializing; perform operations anonymously.
  • SASL mechanism provided - Use the given SASL mechanism to bind when initializing connections.

name: cas.webflow.crypto.encryption.key
description: The encryption key. The encryption key by default and unless specified otherwise must be randomly-generated string whose length is defined by the encryption key size setting.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.groovy[].order
description:
The order of this attribute repository in the chain of repositories.
Can be used to explicitly position this source in chain and affects
merging strategies.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.linked-in.scope
description: The requested scope.

name: cas.authn.mfa.duo[].bypass.authentication-handler-name
description:
Skip multifactor authentication depending on form of primary authentication execution.
Specifically, skip multifactor if the a particular authentication handler noted by its name
successfully is able to authenticate credentials in the primary factor.

name: cas.consent.ldap.page-size
description: Request that the server return results in batches of a specific size. See RFC 2696. This control is often used to work around server result size limits. A negative/zero value disables paged requests.

name: cas.authn.pm.reset.mail.validate-addresses
description: Set whether to validate all addresses which get passed to this helper.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.discovery.kubernetes.api-retries
description: Defines the number of retries to Kubernetes API. Defaults to: 3.

name: cas.saml-sp.open-athens.sign-assertions
description: Indicate whether assertions should be signed.

name: cas.authn.ldap[].validator.scope
description: Search scope to use for the search request of the search validator.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.saml[].response-binding-type
description:
The SAML2 response binding type to use when generating metadata.
This ultimately controls the binding type of the assertion consumer
service in the metadata.
Default value is typically {@code urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST}.

name: cas.server.tomcat.clustering.receiver-auto-bind
description: Default value is 100. Use this value if you wish to automatically avoid port conflicts the cluster receiver will try to open a server socket on the port attribute port, and then work up autoBind number of times.

name: cas.service-registry.json.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.dropbox.id
description: The client id.

name: cas.authn.saml-idp.metadata.git.crypto.alg
description: The signing/encryption algorithm to use.

name: cas.acceptable-usage-policy.ldap[].keystore-password
description: Keystore password.

name: cas.authn.throttle.hazelcast.cluster.wan-replication.replication-name
description: Name of this replication group.

name: cas.service-registry.ldap.service-definition-attribute
description: Service definition attribute used for the registered service entry in LDAP to keep a representation of the service body.

name: cas.spring.cloud.dynamo-db.write-capacity
description: Write capacity.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.dynamo-db.time-offset
description: Time offset.

name: cas.person-directory.principal-transformation.suffix
description: Suffix to add to the principal id prior to authentication.

name: cas.scim.target
description: The SCIM provisioning target URI.

name: cas.ticket.registry.hazelcast.cluster.core.partition-member-group-type
description:
With {@code PartitionGroupConfig}, you can control how primary and backup partitions are mapped to physical Members. Hazelcast will always place partitions on different partition groups so as to provide redundancy. Accepted value are: {@code PER_MEMBER, HOST_AWARE, CUSTOM, ZONE_AWARE, SPI}. In all cases a partition will never be created on the same group. If there are more partitions defined than there are partition groups, then only those partitions, up to the number of partition groups, will be created. For example, if you define 2 backups, then with the primary, that makes 3. If you have only two partition groups only two will be created.
  • {@code}PER_MEMBER Partition Groups}: This is the default partition scheme and is used if no other scheme is defined. Each Member is in a group of its own.
  • {@code}HOST_AWARE Partition Groups}: In this scheme, a group corresponds to a host, based on its IP address. Partitions will not be written to any other members on the same host. This scheme provides good redundancy when multiple instances are being run on the same host.
  • {@code}CUSTOM Partition Groups}: In this scheme, IP addresses, or IP address ranges, are allocated to groups. Partitions are not written to the same group. This is very useful for ensuring partitions are written to different racks or even availability zones.
  • {@code}ZONE_AWARE Partition Groups}: In this scheme, groups are allocated according to the metadata provided by Discovery SPI Partitions are not written to the same group. This is very useful for ensuring partitions are written to availability zones or different racks without providing the IP addresses to the config ahead.
  • {@code}SPI Partition Groups}: In this scheme, groups are allocated according to the implementation provided by Discovery SPI.

name: cas.authn.mfa.u2f.bypass.principal-attribute-value
description: Optionally, skip multifactor authentication based on designated principal attribute values.

name: cas.authn.surrogate.jdbc.leak-threshold
description: Controls the amount of time that a connection can be out of the pool before a message is logged indicating a possible connection leak.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].validate-periodically
description: Whether connections should be validated periodically when the pool is idle.

name: cas.authn.x509.ssl-header-name
description: The name of the header to consult for an X509 cert (e.g. when behind proxy).

name: cas.authn.mfa.web-authn.mongo.socket-keep-alive
description: Whether the database socket connection should be tagged with keep-alive.

name: cas.authn.pm.jdbc.password-encoder.secret
description: Secret to use with {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#STANDARD}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#PBKDF2}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#BCRYPT}, {@link PasswordEncoderTypes#GLIBC_CRYPT} password encoders. Secret usually is an optional setting.

name: cas.http-web-request.header.enabled
description: Allow CAS to inject and enforce http security headers via an http filter that are outlined here for caching, HSTS, etc.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].sasl-authorization-id
description: SASL authorization id.

name: cas.account-registration.mail.attribute-name
description: Principal attribute names that indicates the destination email address for this message. The attributes must already be resolved and available to the CAS principal. When multiple attributes are specified, each attribute is then examined against the available CAS principal to locate the email address value, which may result in multiple emails being sent.

name: cas.authn.mfa.simple.token.bypass.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.redis.cluster.dynamic-refresh-sources
description: Whether to discover and query all cluster nodes for obtaining the cluster topology. When set to false, only the initial seed nodes are used as sources for topology discovery.

name: cas.authn.mfa.gauth.ldap.search-entry-handlers[].case-change.attribute-value-case-change
description: The Attribute value case change.

name: cas.authn.mfa.trusted.device-fingerprint.cookie.domain
description: Cookie domain. Specifies the domain within which this cookie should be presented. The form of the domain name is specified by RFC 2965. A domain name begins with a dot (.foo.com) and means that the cookie is visible to servers in a specified Domain Name System (DNS) zone (for example, www.foo.com, but not a.b.foo.com). By default, cookies are only returned to the server that sent them.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oidc[].keycloak.preferred-jws-algorithm
description:
The JWS algorithm to use forcefully when validating ID tokens.
If none is defined, the first algorithm from metadata will be used.

name: cas.authn.oidc.jwks.jpa.url
description: The database connection URL.

name: cas.authn.x509.principal-transformation.groovy.location
description:
The location of the resource. Resources can be URLs, or files found either on the classpath or outside somewhere in the file system.

In the event the configured resource is a Groovy script, specially if the script set to reload on changes, you may need to adjust the total number of {@code inotify} instances. On Linux, you may need to add the following line to {@code /etc/sysctl.conf}: {@code fs.inotify.max_user_instances = 256}.

You can check the current value via {@code cat /proc/sys/fs/inotify/max_user_instances}.

name: cas.authn.pac4j.oauth2[].display-name
description:
Indicate the title or display name of the client
for decoration and client presentation purposes.
If left blank, the client original name would be used by default.

name: cas.authn.attribute-repository.ldap[].keystore-password
description: Keystore password.

name: cas.authn.mfa.inwebo.browser-authenticator
description:
The browser authenticator to use (or none). Available values are as follows:
  • {@code NONE}: No browser authentication.
  • {@code VIRTUAL_AUTHENTICATOR}: Virtual Authenticator browser authentication.
  • {@code M_ACCESS_WEB}: mAccessWeb browser authentication.
